text: sigh. the news these days carries a different weight for those of us who can relate to dr. ford all too closely. #sexualassaultvictim i have not watched the hearings and testimonies live because i just can’t. i can’t imagine facing my aggressor. i’d likely sob and vomit on the spot. this is largely why i didn’t want my case to go to court martial. a couple thoughts though. when a sexual assault victim chooses to report their assault, they are putting their integrity and credibility on the line. all i have about my assault is my truth and reporting is opening my truth up to the opinions of others. it’s a very vulnerable place to be in. and it was awful. secondly, kavanaugh may very well be a good man with quality characteristics. however that doesn’t excuse him from being held accountable for his actions and then enduring the consequences which for him may be losing his nomination. my aggressor was highly regarded in our community, high ranking, charming, and a good man. but none of those things remove the fact that he used his power and authority to sexually assault me and should be held accountable for that. i find the hardest conversations i have about my assault are with people who are reluctant to outrightly condemn my aggressor because i can see self reflection occurring and they can’t condemn my aggressor without condemning themselves for actions in their past. it takes great humility to do that and pride and self preservation often win. and as much as my heart is breaking for dr ford, i also believe that kavanaugh has every right to defend himself and have legal counsel. that doesn’t negate dr ford’s rights and truth though either. anyway, as always we need to keep talking about this. i’m here and willing to talk. #metoo #whyididntreport #sexualassaultawareness #knowmoredobetter

text:
i feel safe amongst men .
.
men are my protectors, my guardians and treat me with honour and with respect. i can laugh and giggle and flirt with joyful innocence and feel safe. .
.
i feel free to hug, to kiss, to make physical contact with men and feel in my knowing that they will never see that as a sexual pass or an invitation.
.
.
these things are said in honour of our brave new world. these things are said to create a new timeline, where the sacred man and sacred woman return to innocence. .
.
as the planet purges sexual disgust, sexual shame, sexual deviances and sexual violence we will be brought together. .
.
the focus right now, rightly and justly so is on #drford; courageous and heroic, this sister is catapulting shadows into light, limelight! .
.
three years ago i gave my ted talk on how childhood sexual abuse affected my life, my mental health and how it drove me to suicidal tendencies. it was a platform to use my voice, when once that same voice was silenced through trauma. .
.
i salute and support any woman, man or child who raises their hand and says #metoo.
.
.
we are all affected by this sickness and the truth is our medicine 🙏 .
.
💫💫if you feel called, my tedxtalk is called "what does resilience look like" under my old name abigail eaton-masters 💫💫
name: Abigail Waters

text:
today i am taking a stand. not for a political party or to simply have an opinion, but rather i am taking a stand for every human who has ever had to utter the phrase #metoo 
forgetting is difficult, but remembering is worse. take a look around. do you see what is happening in america right now? this is why people don’t tell anyone they have been sexually assaulted. 
what message are we sending people who have been harmed? maybe you should assess if you are part of this cultural problem that hinders people from telling? you have to remember, a survivor’s entire sense of safety has already been ripped away from them...but the notion that they are going to tell immediately after the worst trauma of their life or else they are lying has to stop now!

the lack of compassion and understanding for survivors of sexual assault has been troubling me more then i can express. maybe because as a therapist, so many times i have been the first person that a client tells their abuse to. 
in fact, just this week i was the first to hear about the sexual assault of a 15 year old innocent child a year and a half after i started working with her! she needed to know she could trust me before sharing something that was going to even further turn her life upside down. her opportunity to be a carefree teenager was robbed from her. 
again this post is not about innocence or guilt... that’s what the justice system is for.  i am here to tell you as a trained professional, there are endless reasons why people don’t tell that they have been assaulted. so right now decide, are you going to be part of the problem or the solution? 
and yes to end this very long post, i am calling people to action. i am committed to heading a group of leaders to engage the community and congress in primary prevention strategies aka let’s stop this before it starts! i will not rest until #metoo turns into #nomore 
if you are a survivor and in need of help, please reach out to me personally. you deserve to break the chains that have been keeping you stuck. 
national sexual assault hotline: 
800.656.hope (4673) 
please feel free to like and share so that survivors know they are not alone.
name: Heather Gorr

today i am taking a stand. not for a political party or to simply have an opinion, but rather i am taking a stand for every human who has ever had to utter the phrase #metoo 
forgetting is difficult, but remembering is worse. take a look around. do you see what is happening in america right now? this is why people don’t tell anyone they have been sexually assaulted. 
what message are we sending people who have been harmed? maybe you should assess if you are part of this cultural problem that hinders people from telling? you have to remember, a survivor’s entire sense of safety has already been ripped away from them...but the notion that they are going to tell immediately after the worst trauma of their life or else they are lying has to stop now!

the lack of compassion and understanding for survivors of sexual assault has been troubling me more then i can express. maybe because as a therapist, so many times i have been the first person that a client tells their abuse to. 
in fact, just this week i was the first to hear about the sexual assault of a 15 year old innocent child a year and a half after i started working with her! she needed to know she could trust me before sharing something that was going to even further turn her life upside down. her opportunity to be a carefree teenager was robbed from her. 
again this post is not about innocence or guilt... that’s what the justice system is for.  i am here to tell you as a trained professional, there are endless reasons why people don’t tell that they have been assaulted. so right now decide, are you going to be part of the problem or the solution? 
and yes to end this very long post, i am calling people to action. i am committed to heading a group of leaders to engage the community and congress in primary prevention strategies aka let’s stop this before it starts! i will not rest until #metoo turns into #nomore 
if you are a survivor and in need of help, please reach out to me personally. you deserve to break the chains that have been keeping you stuck. 
national sexual assault hotline: 
800.656.hope (4673) 
please feel free to like and share so that survivors know they are not alone.

text:
this isn’t about today’s vote but rather it’s about today’s state of existence in the world. this isn’t about politics or race or religion - this is about humanity evolving as i just don’t have enough details to side with anyone and i’ve been lied to enough times to know the truth. this is about the survival and the evolution of the human species. we need to be better in all respects. we need to be able to trust in our trust. just my 2 cents.
#angel_writer #metoo#whyididntreport

text:
update: the senate judiciary committee has agreed to delay its vote on kavanaugh to allow time for an fbi investigation into the sexual assault allegations against the judge. 
the committee voted 11-10 to send kavanaugh's nomination to the full senate for a vote earlier on sept. 28, 2018. prior to the vote, sen. jeff flake asked for a one-week delay to allow time for an fbi investigation. 
the senator is seen listening to debates on kavanaugh’s nomination (photo 1) and speaking to sen. feinstein and sen. leahy during today’s meetings (photo 2), before the 11-10 vote took place. ⁣
photos by kevin dietsch @photodietsch/upi.⁣
#upi #upilegacy #upioriginals #kavanaugh #flake #senatorflake #metoo #supremecourt #fordblasey #sexualassault #scotus #womensrights #kavanaughhearing

text: it’s #feministfriday! ✨ this week we have none other than the iconic activist who started the #metoo movement: tarana burke. burke, an american civil rights activist, began using “me too” back in 2006 to spread awareness about sexual assault, and in 2017 the phrase evolved into the #metoo movement. in 2017, she was time’s person of the year as a member of what the magazine called “the silence breakers.” her voice, her ideas, and the movement she has worked so hard for is so important. thank you, tarana burke, for all the work you continue to do 👏🏼🙏🏼💗

text: saw a clip of the ridiculous questions and comments anita hill was subjected to by a panel of men back in the day, lacking compassion or even human decency. from men sadly responsible for running our country. yesterday’s outbursts from similar minded ignorance, immaturity and lack of compassion was not much different with the gentlemen obviously siding with kavanaugh. if a panel of women ever treated a man the way these women have been treated, it would be considered outrageous and unjustified, they would be called nasty women, and worse, they would say women are overemotional and probably on their periods! that’s how pathetic and desperate these kinds of men are. but these two women held their composure, kept their dignity, and stood in their integrity, despite all of this madness. i personally would have thrown a chair at one of their heads. 🤬but i am inspired. i am in awe. and i see how we can better hold our power while feeling our vulnerability thanks to these women. i am also feeling heartbroken that this still exists and that we haven’t fully learned from the past and some women are even standing by “boys will be boys” mentality. this is a bit shocking. thank god for the empowered and higher minded men showing up. i am grateful to see these open minded and protective men out there who are standing up with women and defending our honor and causes. who want to make a better future for all of us, and who are also saying enough is enough. because these men will teach their sons to be respectful and our daughters to be strong, which will give us all a safer future. we just want men to be in the masculine power they were meant to be in, not violent and overpowering - so we can be in our feminine power and let our gifts shine - instead of being scared to be seen or heard. it’s about creating balance, fairness and wholeness as a nation. #believethesurvivors #enoughisenough #thefutureiseveryone #wecanbebetter #weneedstrongmen #weneedstrongwomen #weneedeachother #ignorancedoesntbelonghereanymore #nastywoman #nooneshouldliveinfear #itsmybodynotyours #metoo

text:
today's #touristfriday is going to be a two parter. on my way to the library of congress i came upon a rally to #stopkavanaugh in front of the surpreme court and i stayed. these women are fighters. these women are powerful. these women are heroes. there were speakers, there were chants and there was marching...all of which i took part in. this is an important time...this is our democracy and we can't lay back and take it. so we marched to chairmen's office and we yelled and when a gentleman came out and tried to get people arrested we stood in silent protest as he became belligerant and some even went inside. we have to stop the violence. boys will not be boys, women are not their toys and those who vote yes have to be voted out this november...remember remember on the 6th of november
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text:
there were 21 senators that heard testimony from kavanaugh and ford, only 4 of them were women. but that’s not why you should be angry. be angry that there have only been 52 women in the u.s. senate total since its establishment in 1789. and then, go register to vote.
-

text:
maria gallagher, 23, confronted sen. jeff flake in an elevator on friday morning, telling him she was sexually assaulted and that nobody believed her. hours later, he demanded a delay in the #kavanaughvote. “he wouldn’t meet my eyes,” she told the daily beast. “it made me very angry. he kept saying thank you and i’m sorry and wasn’t taking into account what his actions would be doing to millions of people and what this means for everyone.” link in bio to read our full interview with her.
____

text:
dr. christine blasey ford, your bravery and strength is all i can think about today. you’ve left me in complete awe. it is with tears in my eyes that i thank you for your astounding courage, that i thank you for sacrificing everything so that we could hear the truth about a man who’s actions clearly deem him unfit to serve in the highest seat of our justice system, creating laws that will effect every man, woman, and child for generations to come. i can’t imagine how hard it was to stand up to the senate committee and describe in detail the most painful experience of your life. your testimony proved that one can be scared to death but still move forward with their truth. your voice has handed other survivors the courage and strength to bring their stories and their voices out of the shadows and into the light. you have brought us one step closer to paving the road to change.
.
today we say “goodbye predators, your day has come”. there is no “boy will be boys”. there should never be questions like “why didn’t she report?”, “what was she wearing?”, “was she drunk?”. etc. we should never hear “but it was in the past”, or “what about his future”.
.
we must change society. this vile disgusting behavior going on in the world, in washington, and perhaps right beside us every day— it must stop. abusive people must be held accountable. we must stand together. because if we don’t, we will all fall together.
.
i stand proudly by dr.ford. i believe her. and her. and her. and her. and so should you.
.
#ibelievechristineblaseyford #believesurvivors #metoo #kavanaughhearings #stopkavanaugh #voteno

.

text:
la entrega de los premios nobel de 2018 comienza el lunes con las recompensas científicas, sin el de literatura, aplazado hasta el próximo año a raíz de un escándalo de abusos sexuales relacionado con la academia sueca.
la institución, que recibió numerosas críticas por premiar al cantante estadounidense bob dylan en 2016, anunció a primeros de mayo que el galardón de literatura de 2018 se entregará junto al de 2019.
el origen del escándalo es el francés jean-claude arnault, al que 18 mujeres acusaron de violación o agresiones sexuales en noviembre de 2017, unas semanas después de las denuncias contra el productor de cine estadounidense harvey weinstein, que originaron el movimiento #metoo.
la mayoría de las investigaciones preliminares sobre arnault se abandonaron por falta de pruebas o porque los delitos habían prescrito, pero la justicia sueca juzgó un caso de violación que se remonta a 2011 y cuyo veredicto se espera el lunes, coincidiendo con la entrega del nobel de medicina.

para ampliar esta información, te invitamos a visitar nuestro portal:http://www.elecuatoriano.com.ec

text:
this summer i moved from a blue state (wa) to a red one (tn.) at @creativemorning / @nashville_cm today, i made my recent move official by registering to vote as a citizen of tennessee. 
_
after yesterday’s display, i sure hope you make your voice heard in the next election. also calling your elected officials to let them know you’ll be voting according to your opinions of yesterday’s events.
_
some say that our votes don’t matter. that *may* be true, (thank you gerrymandering and electoral college) but if your apathy takes over your time, investments, creative expression, and usage of the rights you have, then you and your legacy will have no choice but to be invisible.
_
you are not invisible. your voice matters. speak up. and then go register to vote! it takes max two minutes.

text:
and where are the men and your support? silent support doesn’t really help in this case or in any other situation ever. 
any form of public support helps, that’s what we need. not only with dr. ford or matters in the states but worldwide. good god people, are we that scared and conditioned that we can’t even stand for anything anymore? that we are happy to passively complain about people, situations and problems instead of actively starting conversations and movements to change our world? and if you’re not sure why we need to change our world, our beliefs and systems of regulation and control, even our cultures and religions, then i ask you, have you ever struggled? have you ever felt outraged about a situation? about a part of life that just didn’t seem fair? i bet you have. so realize we need change so that the generations after us do not have to fight so hard to get something just even close to equality. so that they do not have to struggle so much and spend years unlearning and healing from the social constructs, conditioning and outright abuse from the patriarchy. if we want things to change, we have to be willing to risk something for that change. #standforsomething

any form of public suppo helps, that’s what we need. not only with dr. ford or matters in the states but worldwide. good god people, are we that scared and conditioned that we can’t even stand for anything anymore? that we are happy to passively complain about people, situations and problems instead of actively staing conversations and movements to change our world? and if you’re not sure why we need to change our world, our beliefs and systems of regulation and control, even our cultures and religions, then i ask you, have you ever struggled? have you ever felt outraged about a situation? about a pa of life that just didn’t seem fair? i bet you have. so realize we need change so that the generations after us do not have to fight so hard to get something just even close to equality. so that they do not have to struggle so much and spend years unlearning and healing from the social constructs, conditioning and outright abuse from the patriarchy. if we want things to change, we have to be willing to risk something for that change.

text:
excited to announce my next book is now available for pre-order.  link in my bio to purchase.

dr. chris is the sex expert you’ve been waiting for. he refuses to pathologize those whose sexuality doesn’t fit in a neat little box and he doesn’t just pay lip service to the pro-sex, feminist, and body-positive mores of the day — he demands them.

rebel love welcomes all sexualities and identities no matter where you fall on the spectrum and empowers people to be authentically who they are both in and out of the bedroom. dr. chris’s prescription for hotter, healthier sex encourages you to stop participating in patriarchal stereotypes, broaden your sexual horizons, and have amazing sex.
.
.

text:
to every person that has ever felt alone, to every person that has ever felt unsafe, to every person that bares the scars of trauma, i see you.
.
thank you to all of the courageous survivors sharing your pain. there are so many people still too afraid to do so and by voicing your experience, you are speaking for those who cannot. you are not alone. we are here. we believe you.
.
.
.
.
.
📸 @emiliebersphoto
.
#metoo #notalone #iseeyou #community #strongertogether #ibelieveher #ibelieveyou #believewomen

text:
seek then speak.
i wasn’t sure whether or not to do this but after recent news and publicity i think it’s best to do it now rather than never.
i am part of the #metoo campaign because one of my friends at 14 took the time to take away my happiness of childhood and take my control of my body in a split second.
it was one of my worst times in life and i live everyday wishing it didn’t happen. unfortunately as a woman it’s hard to speak the truth about assault but after reading the current movements in justice for frequent sexual misconducts toward women all across the world i needed to do this. if anyone has been through this or a similar situation i will always be understanding and support those who don’t have their safety net to connect them to the real world, i have grown so much as a person after being assaulted and it’s taught me that all you need in life is you, and people who want you. so never let anyone tell you different. assault is not something to be embarrassed about as predictors have their victims and we can’t help that. all we need to do now is stand together and fight against the animals that take our control and our freedom, and fight back.#metoo #metoomovement

text:
when the first round of #metoo hashtags came around, i was angry. not because i suddenly realized that the women around me had their own stories of sexual assault-i knew that already. rather, i was angry that after all we have shouldered, we needed to relive our trauma to educate “good men” about women face in this society.

given that most of the women i knew had experienced sexual assault, it seemed statistically impossible that all men around me were good and were completely oblivious to what was happening. i knew this to be a fallacy after an event in college. 
i was walking home from a late night chemistry lab when i realized i was being followed by a group of 5 men. hoping it was a coincidence, i swung by my house instead of going to a friends house. i watched out the window as they sat outside my apartment for 5 minutes, then left. i waited for another 5 minutes then headed back out. they emerged from a bush and pursued me. i ran. i ran until i reached a house with some male friends that i knew.

running from men in bushes scared me, but had prepared for this my entire life. rapists wait in bushes, this was a known nightmare. the heartbreak came when i burst into the house of good men, crying, and afraid and was met with disdain rather than compassion. i was treated as a burden for asking them to use their maleness to protect me, and i felt weak and ashamed for having to ask. 
this story is supposed to be about a time when i was lucky, i was not caught by the bad men in bushes. but i was betrayed and abandoned by the good men in a house. men that believed i earned being pursued by returning from a class too late at night, on the streets where they were free to roam. they put themselves in a different category than the bad men in bushes but to me, they were all the same. they were people in a world that did not believe that i mattered as a human being. 
i feel the same this week as i did standing in that room, alone, crying and scared. i know so many women feel the same. to you i say, i see you, i hear you, and i believe you. you matter. 
#believeus

text: tw - like many of you, this has been an extremely difficult week and yesterday was one of the toughest days for sexual assault survivors. when i was in my early 20s, someone i was on a date with drugged me, took me to his home while i was unconscious, and raped me. it took nearly a decade for me to be able to tell anyone. therapy, among other things, has made a big difference but i have to be honest, yesterday was one of the hardest days and nights i've ever been through. in the midst of my soul howling and weeping in anger and pain last night, i had a few fleeting moments of suicidal thoughts and it scared the shit out of me. the personal and collective trauma we are being forced to relive right now can feel unbearable but i know we are so incredibly strong. we will not just get through this, but we will make lasting changes. the bravery and strength of women like dr. ford keeps me going and encourages me to speak my truth and shine my light out into the world. if you are struggling right now, you are not alone. if you're not comfortable sharing your story, please don't feel guilty or feel that you're not being brave. being a survivor looks and feels different for everyone and there is no one right way or one timeline. most important is to take care of yourself and please know it was not your fault. i believe you. #metoo #believesurvivors #smashthepatriarchy

text: #metoo the most memorable metro moment for me was working at the university campus kitchen when i was 22. two of the male staff would make it a point of cornering me in the walk in refrigerator consistently. did they touch me? no. but they would make incredibly inappropriate comments and stand inappropriately close to me. the feeling of knowing it was wrong but not wanting to rock the boat. the feeling of wanting to wear a sweater over my already baggie t-shirt because i didn’t want them staring at my chest and making veiled inappropriate comments. not wanting to get them in trouble because they were nice to me.  at 23 i was a young kid who was naive and didn’t know you could tell someone in a power position to f the hell off. my hope is that i can try to teach my girls that they have total@ownership over their bodies and no one has the right to put them in a situation where they don’t feel safe. bless my momma because she taught me that and i think had i been a little older and less hungry for acceptance i would have reported.

text:
saturn in capricorn. just a reminder, y’all. we’re thick into this transit that lasts until 12/20. and it’s all about the patriarchy and dominion.
😑
but saturn’s transit isn’t the end. it’s the means to an end. and it’s one whose story is grounded in maturity and wisdom as much as authority and mastery. so while we feel to be flailing around in the latter it is the former that ultimately wins out once saturn shuffles on down horoscope lane.
🤨
we just gotta be like a goat 🐐 and dig in, hold on, and believe in ourselves.
🐐🐐🐐
#replanoly @fedosov_nature
.

*

sincerely,

your wellness

i’m a #woman.

and remind her to always speak her truth.

text:
mama needed a moment to breathe deeply this morning, so we went to the woods. it’s the only place that soothes me a lot of the time. free from the indecency, the trauma, the noise.
.
it’s been a rough week sisters, for those of us who have lived truths like the event dr. ford spoke of, and those who support us. our government has failed us, and continues to fail us (and by us i mean any and all minorities and groups who have been displaced/exploited/destroyed by any sort of oppressor). as dear @glennondoyle wrote, “we are ungoverned, so we will become ungovernable.”
.
i’ve had a hard time dealing with what’s happening because of my own past, but also because of the future and what my children may face if nothing changes. how am i going to raise my daughter to value herself in a world where her worth and well-being is not valued by those in positions of power?how will i teach my son to not only do what’s right but to call out what is not in a world where terrible, perverse actions against women are excusable, a rite of passage, so common we literally think nothing of it?
.
if you’re a survivor, breathe. if you love a survivor, breathe. if you fear for your children in a world that’s gone mad, breathe. if you want to fight like hell to burn the patriarchy to the ground but you are tired, breathe.
.
breathe, my loves. take care of yourself. stay aware, stay enraged, and ready yourself. it’s not over. we women are just getting started.
.
.
#ibelieveher #ibelievechristineblaseyford #metoo #whyididntreport #selfcare #quietthechaos #togetherrising #mom #mommy #parenting #fightlikehell #daughter #equality #justice #cancelkavanaugh #womenempowerment #womensupportingwomen #wecanbebetter #ibelievedrford #optoutside #adventuremamas #honesty #childhoodunplugged #hiking #nature

text_retweet:
i still can't talk about it, and maybe one day with all the inspiration from the women coming forward with their own stories i will,  but for now this says what i can't.
#settheworldonfire #courage #believe 
#repost @wisetobewild
• • • • •
today with a quivering voice, i heard dr. christine blasey ford admit she was terrified and proceed with her testimony anyway. although i have always been in support of the me-too movement, i never really shared my own story. but something about her courage makes me want to finally say #metoo. ⠀
⠀
its happened more than once. in momentary awkward ways that made me feel embarrassed and small. it's happened in catastrophic ways that left me sobbing with a sense of shame that sat in my stomach for years. my abusers were strangers, acquaintances, co-workers, people i thought were my friends and even people i thought loved me.⠀
⠀
why i didn't report.....because not only was i in denial but the entire world around me was as well. just like my culture blamed me, i also blamed myself. ⠀
⠀
but i do not say this as a victim but as a survivor. each time i got back up, healed the wound, and learned how to love and trust again.⠀
⠀
to all the survivors- you're not alone. although the world might try to deny, accuse, attack, berate and belittle- i hear your story, i believe your truth and i stand with you. courage is contagious. thank you to all of the hundreds of thousands who gave me the courage i have today. ⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀

text:
there are many reasons why a #victim or #survivor would choose not to report sexual violence: fear, shame, guilt, embarrassment, or the desire to try to "forget" about what happened. particularly for men, victims feel a sense of emasculation - like he should have been able to defend himself. 
#justice looks different for every victim, so while one survivor may want to report, another may choose to keep it to him or herself. the latter is often the case, which is why the majority of rapes go unreported. 
it is their story, and they have the power to do with it what they want.

advocates are available 24/7 for free and confidential #support. 1.800.770.1650 or text 'iowahelp' to 201-21.

#metoo #metoomovement #timeisup #endsexualviolence #whyididntreport #supportsurvivors #iowa #text #call #hotline

text:
all dr. christine blasey ford could do was share her story and she did so in the most polite and level-headed way possible. she did it as she stood facing a group of people who had already declared themselves against her. she spoke her truth, and i believe whole heartedly that it is the truth. it would be less plausible if she had every small detail of that day memorized. if it seemed more like a rehearsed story than a faint memory with one large, traumatic moment that split her life into a “before” and an “after.” trauma alters our memory as our brain works hard to protect us from the memory of severe pain and shame. people criticize dr. ford for not knowing every detail of what happened to her 35 years ago. they criticize her for not reporting the assault after it occurred. all that tells me is that those people are lucky enough to have never experienced the horrific short term and long term effects of sexual assault. my experience, which is so similar to dr. ford’s happened 10 years ago, and i never reported it. the details are fuzzy but i know with all my certainty what happened and who did it. i cannot imagine standing in front of a group of angry men, who have pre-determined that i am a liar and that my worst experience is something i invented, and stay as calm and poised as she did. as she said so poignantly herself, ““it is not my responsibility to determine whether mr. kavanaugh deserves to sit on the supreme court. my responsibility is to tell you the truth.” she did her job as a citizen and and she is a pillar of courage for having done so. no matter the outcome, she is my hero. •
•

all dr. christine blasey ford could do was share her story and she did so in the most polite and level-headed way possible. she did it as she stood facing a group of people who had already declared themselves against her. she spoke her truth, and i believe whole heaedly that it is the truth. it would be less plausible if she had every small detail of that day memorized. if it seemed more like a rehearsed story than a faint memory with one large, traumatic moment that split her life into a “before” and an “after.” trauma alters our memory as our brain works hard to protect us from the memory of severe pain and shame. people criticize dr. ford for not knowing every detail of what happened to her 35 years ago. they criticize her for not repoing the assault after it occurred. all that tells me is that those people are lucky enough to have never experienced the horrific sho term and long term effects of sexual assault. my experience, which is so similar to dr. ford’s happened 10 years ago, and i never repoed it. the details are fuzzy but i know with all my ceainty what happened and who did it. i cannot imagine standing in front of a group of angry men, who have pre-determined that i am a liar and that my worst experience is something i invented, and stay as calm and poised as she did. as she said so poigtly herself, ““it is not my responsibility to determine whether mr. kavanaugh deserves to sit on the supreme cou. my responsibility is to tell you the truth.” she did her job as a citizen and and she is a pillar of courage for having done so. no matter the outcome, she is my hero. •

text:
i reject the notion of smashing the patriarchy, because i envision someone taking a hammer in a rage swinging it over & over, hitting whatever gets in the way.⠀
⠀
i am not in a blind rage.⠀
⠀
i am not angrily shouting to defend myself & attacking others because my wealthy white male privilege has been threatened. we saw who you really are, #brettkavanaugh. we saw you.⠀
⠀
when my stepfather had angrily lost his shit, i knew what to expect. he would hit until he was done, then send me away from him. that merely required endurance on my part.⠀
⠀
what was terrifying was walking into my home with him sitting quietly in the dark. when he was calm, his rage transfixed at subzero temperatures. i’d have no idea why he was angry that day, what was coming, & it wasn’t physical. it was psychological torment, him creating a minefield of questions for me to tiptoe through. him searching for any reason to drop severe punishment even when i had done nothing. and then, even if i made it, there was still a firing squad at the end. always taking away something deeply meaningful to me, stripping my ability to leave my tortuous home for weeks or even months at a time.⠀
⠀
it was calculated.⠀
⠀
it was soul crushing.⠀
⠀
that is what we will do to the patriarchy. the parallel ends at innocence, because the patriarchy is not innocent. it destroys women, men, queer, non-binaries, poc, the poor, non-christians—everyone who isn’t born into the power structure adds to the pile of bodies that the patriarchy is built upon.⠀
⠀
i’m not just a body.⠀
⠀
i’m a human being.⠀
⠀
i’m standing up.⠀
⠀
i’m speaking out.⠀
⠀
join me.⠀
⠀
with methodical & calculated work we will grab hold of this evil system and crush the motherfucker to dust in our fists.
name: 🔥Freedom After Trauma🔥

text:
with everything that has been going on the last few days i can't stop thinking about the women at @texaschristianuniversity i was so fortunate to speak with earlier in the year. this was a clip from our discussion about how the women on campus are supporting the belief that they are less than and must use their bodies as currency in exchange for love and acceptance. ”filtering photos, wearing as little clothing as possible to get male attention, drinking to fit in, putting other girls down to compete for a guy...” the answers kept coming! ”continuing to hook up with or date guys that don't respect you, calling girls sluts and shaming them for behaviors that guys brag about, only talking to other girls about how they look or what they are wearing.” when i asked them how it made them feel to be disrespected by the men and frat culture on campus? they replied, ”worthless, like the person i am doesn't exist only my body matters, self conscious, depressed, like we are constantly lowering our standards.” when i then asked them how they felt about the lack of support from fellow women on campus the response was a unanimous;”sad.” as i looked at these beautiful young women, i felt the sadness and it has stayed with me. the women on this campus make up roughly 60% of the student body. the women of the united states currently make up 50.6% of the population.  i will ask you the same question i asked this room of 400 female students... why are you giving away your power? it is time to shed the weight and burden of your self-lothing, trauma, and pain because it doesn't belong to you. i will leave you with my favorite poem: you were born with potential. 
you were born with goodness and trust. you were born with ideals and dreams. you were born with greatness. 
you were born with wings. 
you are not meant for crawling, so don't. 
you have wings. 
learn to use them and fly.
rumi
#together #riseup #katiehwillcox #tcu #healthyisthenewskinny #timesup #metoo #youcan #believesurvivors #fratculture #fly

text:
@regran_ed from @juliette_renard_author -  statistics say that one in three women is sexually abused. i would up that number to three in three women. every fucking woman in the world puts up with bullshit patriarchy claims every damn day. we have sexual rights taken away, medical rights taken off insurance, people staring at us any damn place we go - whether or not they act on what they’re thinking. and then there’s this fucking goofball perv being sworn in despite the fact that nobody believes him, but the people in power just don’t care that he did it. why? because they did it too. sometimes it’s disgusting watching this shit go down, because we didn’t need another reminder so soon after trump that there are very bad people being put in power, and no matter how loud we shout, there’s nobody out there that will believe us and can do a damn thing about it. #metoo #regrann :
#timesup #startbelieving

text:
@regran_ed from @lavernecox -  thanks for this @mattmcgorry

@regran_ed from @mattmcgorry -  brett kavanaugh is the symptom. rape culture and patriarchy is the disease. same with trump. same with the rapists outted by the #metoo movement (not to mention white supremacy, capitalism, etc). men, if you actually care...listen to women, and the women on the front lines of the anti-sexist, anti-rape culture, feminist movement and get to work. and if you’re a man, wondering if i’m talking about you, i can assure you that i am. you need to be a man that other men know stands against rape culture. that other men know won’t let this shit slide. that other men can come to you with their questions about what to do to be a part of the solution. we all have circles of influence, and we need to influence them. we don’t deserve credit for not being a kavanaugh, a trump, or a weinstein. the only way to change this world to make it safer for women and girls is to be preemptive and do the shit that you see almost no other men doing. when you see lots of women in your life re-posting an article or a meme about rape culture, but not men doing it, you do it. violence against women is *men’s* violence against women over 99% of the time. this is our job to fix. guys, next time you hear liberal men complaining about kavanaugh, ask “what are you doing to end rape culture?” - #regrann
name: SupaNova leader of Klovers!🍀🍀🍀

text:
#metoo possible trigger warning
.
.
i am a (repeat) sexual assault survivor. i am one of the many women who never went to the authorities. i am one of the many women believed to have exaggerated my claims. i am one of the many survivors accused of wanting it or causing it because i was intoxicated. i am one of the many women who was terrified to say anything. i am one of the many women manipulated into thinking i had something to do with it. i am one of the many women who said no 17 times but eventually conceded, allowing room for people to tell me i was to blame because i didn't stop it. i am one of the many women too traumatized to pursue legal help for fear of my treatment and the trauma induced by reliving what occured. i am one of the many women forced to continuously be civil with my abuser, allowing people to think it obviously didn't happen. i am one of the many women tormented that i never spoke to authorities because i now bare the responsibility of "what if he did this to someone after me and speaking up would have stopped that". i am one of the many women who carry a life time of scars because of the sexual assaults i have endured. i am one of the many women terrified to talk about it now, as my heart races and my palms sweat. i am one of the many women that questions her assaults because of the barrage of messages we send females about rape. i am one of the many women who even struggle to believe myself when i say i was sexually assaulted. we need to stop teaching girls and women all of the messages that make them think all of these things. we need to stop punishing women for speaking up. we need to make the violators accountable. and we need to stop teaching women that touching your body isnt a consensual isnt your choice, that's just what happens and suck it up and deal with it, it wasn't that bad. one day soon i hope to share some of my stories, but until i gain the strength to do so, i will continue to remind myself "i believe me!" #metoo #ibelieveyou #ibelieveme #feminism #womensrights #lgbtq

text:
trigger warning ⚠️ another #tabootruths.. when the vocabulary doesn’t exist, what happened to you doesn’t need to be defined – it needs no name. it hovers somewhere between guilt and self-blame, pain and fear. 💔 
gossip without speaking? you'd be surprised how easily that can happen. 👄

when the language doesn’t exist for what is actually going on, just like #daterape wasn’t a word, just like #consent wasn't in the conversation - it is acceptable to gossip but not acceptable to call it out. it's time we call out the #codeofsilence 🤐

text:
i think the way things have been playing out on the news & in the political spotlight have been very traumatic for some of us. but what's important to remember is this: you are stronger than you think & your voice matters.

it doesn't matter who told you no one would listen, who told you no one would care, who insisted no one would believe you.

your voice matters.

text:
i was 16 and he was my brother’s much older friend. it took me years to even tell about it to anyone. so never blame the victim. 
i’m so fed up with this bs going around the 🌎. basic human rights are being questioned - and it needs to be stopped. right now.
teach your daughters and sons what is right and what is not. and let them know - if something bad happens- and they talk - they’ll be heard and taken seriously. and more importantly- they will not to be blamed.
#whyididntreport #metoo #neverblamethevictim

text: a blurry backstage photo after i interviewed caitlin moran in front of 1,000 people in bath tonight about her new book how to be famous. i will remember tonight for a long time. i read her first book how to be a woman when i was 21. i was insecure, uncomfortable in my own skin, i was completely lost, i didn't know who i was. i read the book on a holiday and something clicked: maybe my feelings were a product of something...the weight loss ads, the constant marketing, the guilt, the sexism, however subtle. because once you see it, you can't unsee. it was the first time i wondered whether maybe i wasn't a freak; maybe i was allergic to the lad culture i grew up around. and fast forward to now, my 29 year old self knows exactly who she is and i'm actually really proud of myself. caitlin was incredible tonight - she spoke about serious topics and she had the audience in hysterics. her latest book how to be famous is incredible and it couldn't be more relevant to the headlines we are currently seeing relating to #metoo. she has spoken to a generation of women, and now she wants to speak to men. men need help too💪 thank you to @mrbsemporium for inviting me to interview caitlin. what a night, and caitlin's fans are the best. 💛

text:
calling attention to behaviors on the bottom bc many participate in the normalization of rape culture and don’t even know it. educate yourselves, listen, call out your friend/professor/coworker/family member, and hold each other accountable. 
a reminder that what happened today, and whatever happens next week (and the next, etc), do not take away from our moments of progress. #metoo and the kavanaugh hearing are historic. for the first time, men in power are afraid. for the first time, there are real consequences for sexual harassment. with what happened to men like harvey weinstein and les moonves, we can only hope for others to think twice before catcalling, sharing a laugh with fellow rapist-friend in the middle of a rape while the woman lies there thinking she may be accidentally murdered, or being quietly complicit in locker room banter. and perhaps 17 year old boys watching the kavanaugh hearing will now realize youth cannot save them in their years to come.

text: i haven’t heard anyone ridicule or attack a man for coming forward with allegations of sexual abuse by a priest, sports coach, etc after many years have passed. 🤷🏻‍♀️ coming forward against anyone means further victimization of the victim, because that is simply how our legal system works with such matters. know this, if any of my attackers were seeking any kind of position of authority like this i would and will do the same. i may not have been strong enough to do so in the past, but things change. #stopvictimshaming #believewomen #metoo #ibelievechristineblaseyford #enough

text_retweet:
repost from @themilitantbaker because these words resonated with me.
i am heartsick over the news lately. and angry. the anger never truly goes away. and it takes so much bravery just to say, hey, #metoo. or say, i won't stand for this anymore. because the fear of being told again that you aren't good enough, aren't credible--that your words, your heart, your whole being is less than the sum of someone else's desire for power is soul crushing. .
#writetogether day 28 wants to know what my biggest challenge as a writer was, and it's this, taking the steps to no longer be complicit in my own fear. it's a new dance every day. writing this post is terrifying. but it's also a mission of mine to write about the hard things in my books, so i'm trying to make it more of a habit in my everyday life too.
.
.
.
#amwriting #amwritingromance #resist #ibelieve #trustwomen

text_retweet:
survivors are expected to prove their assault to men who have already made up their minds.
over. 
and over. 
and over. 
and over. 
that it happened. 
that it was enough. 
that it wasn’t a misunderstanding. 
that it wasn’t their fault. 
that it broke them apart. 
that a man can be charming, nice, and adored by all, and still not be a good man. 
it’s frustrating to the point of being spiritually paralyzing. and it’s fucking trash. 
i am so sorry if you were not/are not believed. i believe you. i believe anita hill. i believe christine blasey ford. 
i’m so sorry you were hurt. i pray you are covered today with peace, comfort, and love, and that any pain that has resurfaced from your trauma eases soon. 💜💜💜 #anitahill #drchristineblaseyford #believesurvivors #metoo #timesup #cancelkavanaugh

#repost @amandaseales with @get_repost
・・・
we believe you.

just leaving this here. #metoo #believesurvivors
. . .
it’s a struggle! being kind is not an invitation for sex. women do not owe you anything for buying dinner, or giving a compliment. we can have a conversation with a man without wanting to sleep with him. somehow men forget that. 
we cannot afford to be silent any longer. i believe survivors. i also believe that these late allegations are the result of normalized behavior. we as a a society minimized the behaviors by chalking it up to “boys being boys” and blaming the victims. but no more. we will be heard. we will vote. we will be the change. #believesurvivors #christineblaseyford #thankyou #changeiscoming #vote #november62018 #survivor #sexualassault #metoo #notokay #timesup #boysknowbetter #istandwithsurvivors

text:
c.w. sexual assault, brett kavanaugh hearing, swearing
🌳
🌳
🌳
🌳
the writing in pen is my diary entry from the day of my most traumatizing sexual assault. i am a very open person, but that night was so ugly and filled me with so much shame that i have not talked to anyone about it, nor do i plan to anytime soon. people don’t write about sexual assault in their fucking daily journal, put your calendar away mr kavanaugh. assault is something people try hard to forget about. assault is something people may never be able to write down. to my friends and family, i’m sorry if i’ve been out of it for the past few days. please don’t hesitate to reach out to me to ask for/offer help. this hearing (much like the entirety of the #metoo movement) is virtually unavoidable for anyone not actively ignoring the news or their social media feeds, and has brought up so much hurt and so many painful memories in myself and in so many other survivors. but it is so important to pay attention to what is happening. fucking listen to dr ford’s testimony. fucking know that she is telling the truth and that she is so strong for doing so. just fucking feel human empathy. don’t give up yet. call your fucking senators.

text: a sexual assault can be one of the most traumatizing experiences for a person to go through. i was 21 when i was violently assaulted by my co-worker one night after work. it took about 6 months before i fully recovered from the shock of it all, but my life had slowly been falling apart in the meantime. i dropped out of my sorority because some of my closest friends, who i had confided in, slut shamed me, i  stopped showing up to work because i couldn’t face my abuser anymore, and i even missed two months of classes that semester. i was failing all of my classes, so my advisors told me my best option would be to drop out of school for the rest of the semester. i persevered through and somehow ended up graduating cum laude, but i can not explain to anyone how lonely and depressed i was throughout the whole process.... so much so that senior year i wanted so badly to end it all. i luckily had amazing friends who helped me through the situation and were there for me during my healing process. watching the kavanaugh hearings yesterday opened up that wound that i’ve been trying so hard to heal, and i know that was so many other people’s feelings yesterday. i’m sick to my stomach that this is the world we live in, one where people with the highest levels of power can be racists, xenophobic, misogynists, and rapists.... dr. christine blasey ford did one of the hardest things imaginable yesterday- all to protect our country and the people who live in it. i stand with dr. ford and all of the millions of survivors in this world. thank you dr. ford for making me feel brave enough to speak up. #stopkavanaugh #metoo #believesurvivors #ibelievedrchristineblaseyford #ibelieveanitahill

text: #metoo feeling the weight of my responsibility to speak out today. i have been there.  on enough occasions that it makes me uncomfortable to think about.  everyone processes their experiences differently.  today my experiences are too close to the surface.  closer than they have been in a long time.  if you’re feeling the same way, if you need someone to talk to- please know that i am here.  i will believe you.  i will listen.  we can, we will fight these monsters together.  solidarity, my friends.  we can do better.  we will do better.  and we won’t back down.

text:
yesterday our own esther testified. owning her own story. speaking truth to power - on behalf of those who have been silenced for so long. whether or not babylon hears you - i hear you. i see you.

for such a time as this. 
survivors please know you are beloved. you are beloved. you are beloved. 
if you need me i am here. to be angry with you. to sit with you. to cry with you. to fight for you. to listen to you. to believe you. 
#ibelievechristineblaseyford #ibelieve #metoo #iwilllisten #advocacy #esther #istandwithher #historyishappening #listen #sexualassault #riseup

text:
i openly shared my truth of childhood sexual abuse in october of 2017.
💡
when i decided to share my truth does not negate what happened to me as a child.
💡
it does not erase the decades of trauma, hurt & pain.
💡
it does not bring me justice.
💡
sharing my truth about being sexually abused at 7 years old has given me...
peace.
healing.
strength.
& 
voice.
💡
not all victims share their stories,
not all victims need too.
💡
i will however share my story for those who can’t find the strength to do so at this time. i will continue to advocate & raise awareness for those who have been sexually abused.
✌🏽💗✨
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

text: i was sexually assaulted almost 2 weeks ago. i struggled up until today to even look at myself in mirror without wanting to either cry or disassociate. i am still not okay, and that’s okay. i can make space for all of my emotions; today i put on make up for the first time since i was raped and i was able to look in he mirror and not break down. win? absolutely. this is going to take time for me to recover from, but i have an awesome group of friends and family supporting me and keeping me going which i am forever thankful for. i want those out there who haven’t shared their sexual assault story to know they aren’t alone. if anyone ever needs to talk, dm me. we got this. #itsokaynottobeokay #survivor #survivors #ibelieveyou #rapesurvivor #rapesurvivors #movingforward #onestepatatime #metoomovement #metoo #notalone #strong

text_retweet:
#repost @carolynsuzuki
・・・
my mind is reeling from the hearing yesterday. 
of course i believe dr. ford. thank you for your courage to speak your truth, i believe you and your desire to uphold your civic duty. you inspire so many of us. ———————————————————
i realized yesterday that this hearing was not a showing of  left vs right, or men vs women, it was a showing of humanity vs self interest. kavanaugh proved to all of us that he is not fit to be a supreme court justice. he showed no diplomacy, anger, zero compassion toward what dr. ford must have been going through regardless of what he remembers or doesn’t remember, he mocked the entire process and accused the “left” of fabricating a witch hunt. 
he does not have a right to be on the supreme court. 
it’s a privilege. it’s the senate’s responsibility to vet this on our behalf. his sense of entitlement is infuriating. if nothing else, i hope this fires us all up to vote this coming november 🔥 
#believewomen #ibelievechristineblaseyford #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #openaccess #stopkavanaugh #callyoursenator #kavanaughhearings #2018 #metoo #timesup #resist #stayhuman #intersectionalfeminism #neworleansabortionfund #openaccessnoaf

text:
growing up the message was always "be a good girl." don't be a slut.

don't have sex.

don't drink.

don't show too much skin.

don't curse.

god forbid, don't get pregnant too early.

if there's one thing i embodied, it was that all of this would be incredibly shameful upon me if it happened.

boys will be boys. especially good 'ole southern boys.

when #metoo happened, my thought was, well, of course me too. of fucking course. me and everyone i've talked to.

at work, at school, in relationships... this trial has been incredibly triggering for many.

listening to dr. ford's testimony reminded me of several times i've been in situations that have crossed the line.

but i didn't report.

it wasn't "bad enough" or "inappropriate enough". i'd put myself in that situation.

or, that's just the way executives in the construction industry (my first job) act.

or, he was boyfriend and maybe that made it ok.

no, no, no.

thank you dr. ford for being so damn brave.

for speaking up and calling out things that we don't talk about.

we all thank you ♥️ 🖼️: @ashlukadraws

text: victims of rape and sexual abuse/assault can come forward whenever they feel they are ready, regardless of their abuser’s power, likability, etc. i’ve been asked so many times, “why report this now? why wouldn’t she come forward when it happened?” and while i attempted to explain, i did not vocalize my feelings enough on this. people who have been through something traumatic have to process what has happened to them and report if, and when, they are ready. the hoard of people in our society immediately ready to jump to the abuser’s defense doesn’t help the likelihood of victims coming forward. why would you tell anyone, if they’re not going to believe you anyway? our mindsets are so skewed, and most of us don’t even realize it. fear that everyone will say “why now? is she lying?” is one of the many reasons victims don’t come forward. i think #metoo,  #believesurvivors, and any other movement that helps to spread the message that victims are not alone and they are heard, is very important. if this can help just one person who’s been holding on to the hurt and shame for too long come forward, and inspire others who have been through something similar, it is a message worth spreading.
name: Tia Lovinggood
tweet_full: victims of rape and sexual abuse/assault can come forward whenever they feel they are ready, regardless of their abuser’s power, likability, etc. i’ve been asked so many times, “why report this now? why wouldn’t she come forward when it happened?” and while i attempted to explain, i did not vocalize my feelings enough on this. people who have been through something traumatic have to process what has happened to them and report if, and when, they are ready. the hoard of people in our society immediately ready to jump to the abuser’s defense doesn’t help the likelihood of victims coming forward. why would you tell anyone, if they’re not going to believe you anyway? our mindsets are so skewed, and most of us don’t even realize it. fear that everyone will say “why now? is she lying?” is one of the many reasons victims don’t come forward. i think #metoo,  #believesurvivors, and any other movement that helps to spread the message that victims are not alone and they are heard, is very important. if this can help just one person who’s been holding on to the hurt and shame for too long come forward, and inspire others who have been through something similar, it is a message worth spreading.

text:
we took our campaign to dillingham yesterday. i’m so grateful to have met with sexual assault and domestic violence survivors at safe, bristol bay’s shelter, prevention, and advocacy agency.
_______
i had the honor to speak with a strong, brave alaska native woman who shared her story. despite the pain she has suffered, she advocates for alaskans who have faced violence. in congress, i will honor her work and fight to ensure that all alaskans feel safe, and have the opportunity to overcome trauma to reach their potential.

text:
“that neurotransmitter encodes memories into the hippocampus, so that trauma-related experience is locked there, so other memories just drift.” this is how dr. ford described why she was so certain of her memories of the sexual assault she claims occurred at brett #kavanaugh’s hands. that memory drove her to action on behalf of all of us, so let’s take a page from her book and return the favor. read more at npqmag.org.
.
.

text: i stand with doctor ford. i keep going from anger to sadness today. sadly, i fear that brett kavanaugh will be voted in. that doesn’t mean we have to stay silent. a brace, fragile and terrified women cane forward yesterday with s brace and very credible story of attempted rape. kavanaugh was rude and belligerent, asking senators if they liked beer and have blacked out. it takes incredible strength for a survivor of sexual assault to come forward. women are blamed and made into the victim. doctor ford, i stand with you! #doctorford #bravery #courage #metoo #survivor #whydidntireport #courage #tellthetruth #ihearyou #listentoyourwomen

text: some days i am the strong-as-fuck amazonian survivor that has literally carried her counterpart through life by the skin of her teeth. some days i am the fearful timid survivor who both needs and deserves whatever space and understanding she can get in order to stay safe and simply manage. both of these women are valid. both of these women are strong and necessary. both of these women are survivors. and both of these women are me. they sure as hell don’t work well together. they often times make me appear at odds with myself. they complicate me and challenge me. today the badass fighting bitch wins out thanks to the inspiration of christine blasey ford and many other survivors telling their stories. tomorrow a different me may win and that is just fine. more woman need to tell their stories. but most importantly more women need to do whatever the fuck is necessary to keep themselves going. whether it be standing and speaking or remaining safe and silent. i applaud and support all of you for surviving in whatever way you have to. and i continue to try and validate you regardless of the difference in our experiences and needs. sending love. #metoo #metoomovement #survivor #christineblaseyford #empoweredwomen

text:
last week, @dadandburied was wrong. and this time it wasn’t about how to load the dishwasher or some other inconsequential item... something happened that shouldn’t happen to me or any woman and i was not impressed with his reaction. small excerpt below, but you can read his full blog post via link in my bio: .
.
.
“as occasionally happens when she (read: anyone) gets together with her friends, the night got away from her and she was out later than she’d anticipated. so i texted her for an update.

due to a series of mishaps with the subway, she’d ended up far afield from where she wanted to be.

enlightened nice guy that i am, i got irritated and scolded my wife for not having taken a car and for putting herself in harm’s way. after all, it was after dark, and she is a woman!” (more via link in bio) 
#supportwomen #believewomen  #ibelievechristineblaseyford #metoo
name: Mom and Buried

text:
🗣 🗣 🗣 🗣
t r u t h
.
never has this word  seemed more like an abstract philosophy when truth is precise, exact and unwavering. 
the silver lining to this shitsmear against human rights is that there is so much truth being boldly and bravely shared by women whom you never imagined had a story of #metoo , too.
 i am one of those women. many many years ago, i was sleeping over at my (then) boyfriends house and was having what i thought was a “sex dream” but when i woke up i realized my then-boyfriend was actually having sex with my sleeping body. and rven though we had had plenty of consensual sex before, in this moment, he decided that that little piece of confirmed interest no longer mattered. he chose to take the liberty of having sex with my sleeping body and that is not something that i will ever forget no matter how much time passes.  i believed i was sleeping beside a person who cared for me and would ultimately protect me from guys who do disgusting shit like this. it took me a long time to be able to label this for what it was. this stuff fucks with your brain endlessly and makes you strangely question so many things about yourself when for me, the only thing i should have been questioning was my taste in boyfriends. 
my story is like a candyland version of assault compared to the true stories i have read in this past week and most all of these stories have been shared by women whom i never knew carried their own  burden of this, terrible truth. truth doesn’t have an expiration date. it was true then, it’s true now and it’s never.
ever.
okay.
ever!
the ex’s identity is as irrelevant as he is to me, but here is something i know about him in present tense; he has two sons and that is horrifying to me. i’d be shocked if this cretin evolved to a place where he would be smart enough to tell his own sons that having sex with a sleeping girl is rape. this cycle doesn’t end until we all stop pretending that women are pretending when they tell their own horrific truth. nobody relives the lonely agony of assault for small reasons. be better than this, people. be better than this, america. #believesurvivors #tellyourtruth #stopkavanaugh #christineblaseyford

text_retweet:
no hay necesidad de ser una persona del medio para vivir cosas así, puede pasarle a cualquiera de nosotros; puede ser una amiga, una hermana, tía, vecina, compañera, puedo ser yo. yo.  pero siempre buscaré encontrar el camino en el que sirva para algo bueno cada situación, en mi travesía infinidad de amigos se han acercado a decirme que les he ayudado y me llena, me da felicidad saber que puedo ayudar y evitar que alguien más viva lo que yo pase. quiero que sepas que si estás pasando algo similar no estás por tu cuenta, sabes que hay quienes te apoyamos y de mi te puedo decir que estaré siempre a tu lado que cuentas conmigo en todo momento. 
#repost @wisetobewild with @get_repost
・・・
today with a quivering voice, i heard dr. christine blasey ford admit she was terrified and proceed with her testimony anyway. although i have always been in support of the me-too movement, i never really shared my own story. but something about her courage makes me want to finally say #metoo. ⠀
⠀
its happened more than once. in momentary awkward ways that made me feel embarrassed and small. it's happened in catastrophic ways that left me sobbing with a sense of shame that sat in my stomach for years. my abusers were strangers, acquaintances, co-workers, people i thought were my friends and even people i thought loved me.⠀
⠀
why i didn't report.....because not only was i in denial but the entire world around me was as well. just like my culture blamed me, i also blamed myself. ⠀
⠀
but i do not say this as a victim but as a survivor. each time i got back up, healed the wound, and learned how to love and trust again.⠀
⠀
to all the survivors- you're not alone. although the world might try to deny, accuse, attack, berate and belittle- i hear your story, i believe your truth and i stand with you. courage is contagious. thank you to all of the hundreds of thousands who gave me the courage i have today. ⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀
⠀

text:
** trigger warning: graphic description ** (no relation to this photo)
⠀
i was raped by someone i dated. it took me 2 years later to realize i had been raped. even now, when i’ve talked about it, i question whether it did happen.
⠀
a night out drinking with friends. i’d had maybe 2 beers, but felt buzzed. went back to his place where i was crashing for the night. we fell asleep. around 2:30am, i awoke suddenly to feel a hand on my backside, which then moved to my left breast. his hand moved down and into my underwear. i remember moving myself away because i was half asleep and still buzzed. but he pulled me back against him.
⠀
and then he was on top of me.
⠀
again, i tried squirming away, telling him no, i just wanted to sleep. i can still feel the weight of his body on top of mine. twice my size. i panicked inwardly, but also froze in my own body. i stopped fighting. just laid there. he did his thing. and then it was over. i rolled over facing away from him, hugging myself, trying to process what had just happened.
⠀
i never brought it up. to him or to anyone. it wasn’t until 2 years later, i was watching a tv show where the characters were in a similar situation and the woman later said she was raped. i experienced my first panic attack.
⠀
i searched “what’s considered rape?” story after story. comment after comment. the same story. they called it rape. i remember staring at a chat window with the sexual assault hotline, wondering if i should reach out. was i assaulted? i didn’t know how to define it. didn’t want to admit to it.
⠀
ever since #metoo began, it’s been triggering navigating discussions, the news, or talking with people. for the longest time, i didn’t consider what happened to me to as rape. or even assault. we were dating. i‘d been drinking. describing what happened to me leads many to question their own experiences. and mine is not unique.
⠀
post-mastectomy, some of these feelings have resurfaced as i navigate being in my own body again. i debated sharing my story for the longest time, but as difficult as it may be to share, i want other women to know you are not alone.
⠀
i see you.⠀
i hear you.⠀
i believe you.

text: i'm not usually one for political posts, but this is so much more than that. what #drchristineblaseyford did yesterday was stand up against injustice. for herself. for women. for all people. no one, regardless of race, gender, ethnicity, sexuality, anything, should be treated with the indignity that she was. and the fact that it's still such a stigma that she, and so many other survivors, carried it inside herself for so long, is truly shameful. we, as human beings, need to be better than that. we cannot stand idly by as the villains committing these crimes go unpunished. we cannot allow survivors to feel as though they stand alone. i won't let my baby boy grow up in a home, or a world, where this stigma is still in existence, nor will i allow him to be raised to think that treating another human being with any indecency, unkindness, or indecency is acceptable. please, everyone, #loveoneanother. #bekind. and #standtogether. #ibelieveher #istandwithsurvivors #noonkavanaugh #metoo #lovealways #peoplearepeople

text: this week has been triggering for me. in more ways then one.  what you see here is a picture of who i used to be and a picture of who i am now.  the person who sexually assaulted me had one main obsession (aside from young women who targeted as needing for a daughter and telling them he was a lonely older man who couldn’t have children.) and that was long blonde hair.  i used to love my hair long. i used to love that it was blonde. used to want it dyed blonder. he stole that from me. i don’t remember the last time that i was comfortable not coloring my hair. or comfortable with longer hair. if it is long at all, i almost never am seen without it being up. he stole my confidence. i almost never go anywhere by myself. let alone talk to anyone without nearly throwing myself into a panic attack. (others have stolen my family through other means) this man (i use that term loosely) stole me. he stole my dignity, self worth, trust and confidence.  it’s been more than 3 years since i’ve seen this man. and even after that i’ve had to deal with random text messages of “i miss you and nobody will ever replace you....i hope you haven’t cut your hair.....” messages.... or “do you have any long hair pictures. i can’t see your facebook.......” and “i hope you miss me...” “i need you....” and many other sick messages..... why am i speaking about this now? because there are others who are just as stupid as i was. others who i hope read this and realize that you can reclaim your life. like i am still fighting to do. this week has been triggering for i’m sure many of us. i’ve seen many of us who are victims struggling this week as it brings our own memories to mind... move on. however we have to do that! we can do it. #forgive #metoo #youareanovercomer #standstrong
name: Bre Shafer

text:
i was in 9th grade. we were in the auditorium learning about theatre and this boy and i started thumb wrestling. he got bored, so he started touching my leg. i wanted him to stop, so i tried to hold his hand. when that wasn’t enough and i said “stop” numerous times, he continued to work his way up my leg and try to touch me through the holes of my jeans. i was surrounded by 25 people and my teacher. no one said anything or spoke up for me.

i am heartbroken to hear all the negativity surrounding dr. christine blasey ford, and i am disappointed in our broken system and tendency to blame the victim. i was groped that day. you don’t just forget the men who take advantage of you. their faces are engraved in your memory and it can take years before you truly feel confident or trust a man again.

just because you don’t have the courage to speak up does not mean you are weak. women are powerful. we rise above, we overcome, and we are ready to take on whatever the world throws at us. we are her and she is us. you are not alone.
#metoo

text_retweet:
#silenceisconsent #speakup #fightback #smashthepatriarchy #womensrights 
#repost @mattmcgorry with @get_repost
・・・
brett kavanaugh is the symptom. rape culture and patriarchy is the disease. same with trump. same with the rapists outted by the #metoo movement (not to mention white supremacy, capitalism, etc). men, if you actually care...listen to women, and the women on the front lines of the anti-sexist, anti-rape culture, feminist movement and get to work. and if you’re a man, wondering if i’m talking about you, i can assure you that i am. you need to be a man that other men know stands against rape culture. that other men know won’t let this shit slide. that other men can come to you with their questions about what to do to be a part of the solution. we all have circles of influence, and we need to influence them. we don’t deserve credit for not being a kavanaugh, a trump, or a weinstein. the only way to change this world to make it safer for women and girls is to be preemptive and do the shit that you see almost no other men doing. when you see lots of women in your life re-posting an article or a meme about rape culture, but not men doing it, you do it. violence against women is *men’s* violence against women over 99% of the time. this is our job to fix. guys, next time you hear liberal men complaining about kavanaugh, ask “what are you doing to end rape culture?”

text: how sad is it that something so awful and wrong would make me feel connected to women and my own mother in a way i’ve never felt before. my mother and i had never shared with one another our stories of abuse prior. we arrived to protest, held up our sign that said #believesurvivors, each holding a corner, and i lost it. to think, even in that moment, i did not know my own mother. and to think, in that very moment, my own mother did not know me. two generations of abuse and secrets, right before my eyes. and to think that in general, we do not know the depths and pains that so many of us carry and walk with silently (i do often wonder— do those that follow this ig know the story behind my smile? behind my fear of loud noises and anger? what do they imagine?). the statistics say that 1 in 3 will be sexually abused in their lifetimes but i think numbers slip us by, which is why the #metoo movement and believing and standing with survivors like #drford is so important. it gives us all an empowered chance to speak our truths, demand the right for an equal voice and for our realities to no longer have to uphold secrets that only hurt us but not our perpetrators. i lost it again as i stared down onto the freeway and ocean of morning oncoming traffic, seeing all of the waving hands, hearing all of the honking salutes. i couldn’t see their faces but i could only imagine what they’d been through and i felt...proud. proud of these humans (and you!) that continue to live their lives the best way they know how to. proud that they would feel strong or empowered enough to roll down their car windows and voice their truths, even in honking form. i felt understood, inspired, and united to strangers i couldn’t even see in such a deep, heartbreaking, beautiful way, which is something i’ve never felt before. it was healing. and finally, i want to thank those that have voiced their truths because they’ve allowed me and my mom and so many of you as well to validate and honor our own, empowering us as well. if our current culture and government won’t change, we will change it. it shouldn’t be left up to us or people like #christineblaseyford. but we will. time’s up❤️✊🏻 #ibelieveyou

behind my fear of loud noises and anger? what do they imagine?). the statistics say that 1 in 3 will be sexually abused in their lifetimes but i think numbers slip us by, which is why the  movement and believing and standing with survivors like  is so impoant. it gives us all an empowered chance to speak our truths, demand the right for an equal voice and for our realities to no longer have to uphold secrets that only hu us but not our perpetrators. i lost it again as i stared down onto the freeway and ocean of morning oncoming traffic, seeing all of the waving hands, hearing all of the honking salutes. i couldn’t see their faces but i could only imagine what they’d been through and i felt...proud. proud of these humans (and you!) that continue to live their lives the best way they know how to. proud that they would feel strong or empowered enough to roll down their car windows and voice their truths, even in honking form. i felt understood, inspired, and united to strangers i couldn’t even see in such a deep, heabreaking, beautiful way, which is something i’ve never felt before. it was healing. and finally, i want to thank those that have voiced their truths because they’ve allowed me and my mom and so many of you as well to validate and honor our own, empowering us as well. if our current culture and government won’t change, we will change it. it shouldn’t be left up to us or people like  but we will. time’s up❤️✊🏻
