text:
meditating in the sun.
.
about women's rights and issues.... here's my take;
.
dear brethren, bros, dudes and male friends.  the world is changing gents, and we need not accept it, but embrace it. see it for what it is... a need. .
empowered female generations will change this world in ways we never could. emboldened young women will add to the good that we have done as its guardians, and build a more compassionate and life-giving world. this is not an attack on men, this movement is an attack on shitty men, on men who feel they are entitled to everything, including women. .
this is an opportunity for us to actually be chivalrous, and protect our women, actually be the good guys, and in many regards this is a movement against outdated dogma, political interference, against the childish and vengeful amongst us who have been misguised by generations of the same before us.
.
many of you are right; it feels shitty being "the bad guy", it is uncomfortable being called out for what we have witnessed and turned a blind eye to, it is an ego-punch to recognize that we may have done things incorrectly in the past.... but as any trauma survivor will tell you; it is in embracing our foibles and recognizing that it is our responsibility to make things right that we grow, and it is in apologizing that we start reconciliation... but also that it is in doing the work that we truly walk that path.
.
i've not been perfect in my record of treating women. i will admit that my programming, my ego, my misguided desires, my selfishness and my entitlement are to blame. for the same reason, my role models didn't necessarily do me justice either, and therefore i have not always done the beautiful goddesses in my life justice either. .
with all this said, i take full responsibility for my actions, for nobody forced me to any end.  i promise to work harder every day to ensure a safe, equal opportunity and welcoming place for the women in my life. i hope you will embrace the discomfort me saying this may cause you, and join us in making change.
.
#womensrights #humanrights #kavanaugh #metoo #protector #igotyou #chivalry #patriarchy #bethechange #mansplaining #meditation #goddess #men

text:
i remember sitting in the bath tub, almost every night trying to let the hot water soak out some of my pain.  sitting in the candle lit darkness resting my eyes after another day of trying to just get by.  by this point i was at my lowest....my marriage was in pieces, my job lost, my own nutrition practice that was the light of my soul lay in ruins and i was on anti-psychotics to manage my pain...and while it was nice to have a break from the pain the side effects from the medication left me without an appetite so my love of food was gone and a more dangerous side effect was the suicidal thoughts that now rose to greet me each day as my eyes opened....i not only thought about it, i had a plan, and while i knew on some level it was a side effect of the drug i still felt drawn down that path every day.  if it wasn't for the fact that i knew it would likely be my young son who would find my body....i'm sure i would not be here today.  so sitting in that bathtub became my cocoon, the birthplace of my plan to rise again.  it was hitting the extreme low that made me realize i had too much to share to simply not continue.  in the months that followed i would get myself off the prescription drug and onto medical marijuana and cbd oil, i would move out of my matrimonial home and begin to find my soul tribe, i would begin to find work that would allow me to have random hours to work around when i needed to rest and most importantly i would begin to heal myself through food, through falling in love with the woman i was and through learning what brought me joy.  it was slow, and painful and full of tears, but it was a beginning....and just like the phoenix i could feel the fires creating me anew.⠀
thank you for staying with me through these two dark posts....i wanted to share how low i got before i was able to begin to rise.  healing is not always pretty....in fact some of the most profound healing seems to happen in bathtubs, or on kitchen floor, covered in tears and snot.  if you find yourself there today, know that beautiful things do take root in the dark, know that you are held and know that you have the strength to rise just like the phoenix.
name: Kat O'Brien

text:
la programación del @festivalgabo 2018 es diversa, responsable y propositiva. poder comunicarla ha sido un honor y me llena de orgullo haber hecho parte de la creación de charlas como estas: •los retos periodísticos del #metoo (rebecca corbett y  ana cristina restrepo- 5 de octubre- 3:30pm- mamm) •historias que se resisten a callar (masha gessen, joseph poliszuk y maría jimena duzán- 3 de octubre- 2:30pm- orquideorama) -•ellas, transformadoras del periodismo (maría elena salinas, pepa bueno, natalia viana, @jinbed y mabel lara- 3 de octubre- 4:30pm- orquideorama) •viajar para contarnos (sabrina duque, santiago gamboa, diego cobo, alejandro torres y pere ortín - 4 de octubre - 5:30pm- teatro explora) •heterodoxias de ruven afanador (@sillaverde y ruven afanador- 4 de octubre-4:30pm- mamm) •por los nuevos caminos de la crónica latinoamericana (leila guerriero, julio villanueva chang y renato cisneros- 5 de octubre- 2:30pm orquideorama) •editar opinión: un desafío incesante (boris muñoz y @jkrincones- 5 de octubre- 4:30pm- mamm) - •africamericanos (@angelunfried, liliana angulo, bruno morais y claudi carreras- 5 de octubre- 10am- orquideorama) •periodismo y diversidad sexual: una ética de las disidencias (@matigonzalezgil, masha gessen y guillermo osorno- 5 de octubre- 6:30pm- mamm)

para ver el resto de la programación vayan a festivalgabo.com y recuerden que todas nuestras actividades son gratuitas y de entrada libre. también transmitiremos todo en vivo a través de facebook y nuestra página web y espero que tengan la oportunidad de disfrutarlalas. ✏️🔍📰💡📽📸🖥🎤🎨🦋 ... #festivalgabo2018 #lahistoriadetrásdelrelato #periodismoiberoamericano #lomejordelperiodismo #fiestadehistorias #mentescuriosas #radio #prensa #televisión #periodismoweb #innovación #redética #éticaperiodística #diversidad #inclusión #libertaddeprensa @festivalgabo @fnpi @redeticafnpi @centrogabo @dmarquinezf @kpdelahoz @fullbacano @msemyo @loresolanonaizzir @jaimeabellobanfi @ricorredor

para ver el resto de la programación vayan a festivalgabo.com y recuerden que todas nuestras actividades son gratuitas y de entrada libre. también transmitiremos todo en vivo a través de facebook y nuestra página web y espero que tengan la oportunidad de disfrutarlalas. ✏️🔍📰💡📽📸🖥🎤🎨🦋 ... #festivalgabo2018 #lahistoriadetrásdelrelato #periodismoiberoamericano #lomejordelperiodismo #fiestadehistorias #mentescuriosas #radio #prensa #televisión #periodismoweb #innovación #redética #éticaperiodística #diversidad #inclusión #libertaddeprensa @festivalgabo @fnpi @redeticafnpi @centrogabo @dmarquinezf @kpdelahoz @fullbacano @msemyo @loresolanonaizzir @jaimeabellobanfi @ricorredor

name: VSG - LGBT - MSW
tweet_full: #whyididntreport #ididntsayno #rapeisrape #metoo #notmyfault

text:
just a simple selfie. 💕
..
you do you. i’ll do me.
..
i respect your rights and i value you as a person.
..
can we all step back and agree to that?
..
i don’t care what party you are, what gender you are, what color you are, or what religion you are.
..
we’re all members of the human race.
..
respect.  plain and simple.
..
men and women both deserve respect.  neither should live in fear.
..
not fear of emotional or bodily assault and fear of disbelief when we speak out.
..
not fear of potentially false life-shattering accusations either.
..
and the only way that happens is to step back and remember we all deserve a chance to speak out... ..
in anger, in sadness, in fear, in disappointment, in whatever emotion we need to express...
..
allow the process to run it’s course for every victim - because you never know which side it is, and some cases i believe it’s both.
..
yes i’ve been there #metoo and it changed who i am... i’ve also watched women destroy men with false or exaggerated claims.
..
i didn’t speak up because i thought no one would have believed me.
..
and because when men go too far, the response of women going too far in return doesn’t fix it!!
..
two sides or more to every story... every voice deserves to be heard... and as rational human beings let’s engage the justice system and allow it to work.
..
women, let’s take responsibility for our side of things - we can be strong and assertive, we can choose our situations wisely and stick together, not just after shtf but before... and help change this culture.
..
men, good men, please don’t be afraid to mentor us, to work with us, to support us. .. ..
because women... this is where we’re headed if we don’t shift things. men are becoming afraid of the risks in supporting us. 💔 ..
..
yes, we have reason to be angry and hurt than we’ve feared men, and that doesn’t make it right or okay for us to cause fear in men in return.  that only perpetuates the cycle.
..
women we are stronger than this.  we are smarter than this.  we deserve better.  so do our men.
..
please step back, and let’s remember: all humans, same side, same planet.

text:
make no mistake about it! racism against people of color will surpass white, black and any other ethnicities in this country. but, if you take away racism and deal with white on white people issues in terms of gender than sexism will reign supreme. 
anita was black and her story was not believed.  professorford deserved more legal support than they gave her. sexism wins again in america.  @embracingblackculture
・・・
time for a quick history lesson. “i’m not even sure we would get to a hearing. i think that a nominee would not make it. i think now we’re going to be vetting people to see if any of these issues are in their past. i think we’ve at least gotten that far.” -these are the words of #anitahill in a recent interview, 27 years after she testified in front of the senate judiciary committee that #clarencethomas sexually harassed her, and boy would she be wrong. anita hill was a black woman who was undermined, her story was not believed, and her credibility was stripped, on a national platform, by a committee of white men who exposed themselves as nothing short of biased and prejudiced. that same bias and prejudice is being exercised today against professor #christinablaseyford. both hill and ford expressed themselves calmly, intelligently, with poise. the same cannot be said for thomas and kavanaugh. recently, hill said, “[#kavanaugh] was able to express a real anger, an aggression, as well as a lot of emotion... no female supreme court candidate would ever have the license to express herself in that way. we still have so far to go in terms of the power that he [kavanaugh] had and the license that he had, to cry or be angry”. diversity has increased, but the senate still fails to be a representative body, which results in processes being upheld that are uninformed, and in no way reflect the reality of people’s lives in this country. anita hill started the conversation, and yes we have the #metoo movement, and yes the power dynamics and gender dynamics are shifting, but this hearing proved that there is still so much more work to do. || #blackhistory #americanhistory #blackwomen #women #racism #sexism #rape #sexualassault  #brettkavanaugh #christinaford

text:
water. the element of the sacral chakra.  if you are in need of some tender care during these times of headlines that reignite trauma buried but never forgotten, please get yourself to the water.  walk in it or beside it. run a bath adding epsom salts and clary sage, jasmine, ylang ylang, or rose essential oils.  light some candles and whisper the prayers your rage needs spoken.  honor that voice.  drink water with orange slices in it.  carnelian and orange calcite to balance you.  reach out to loved ones if needed.  you are not alone in this.

text: the last few days have been filled with sadness, anger, confusion, frustration....repeat. over the course of my life, like many women, i have been on the receiving end of inappropriate sexual behavior from men. my oldest daughter at the young age of 24 has experienced more trauma than i can almost handle. my younger two children have also been effected through the loss of a parent that was convicted of inappropriate sexual behavior. i have multiple friends that have experienced trauma and are advocates for those that feel they have no voice...both female and male survivors. this behavior has to stop! if you are pissed off...do something! if you are annoyed and find this all to be a waste of time and dont see the problem? shame on you...you are the problem.  #personaldevelopment #growth #survivor #domesticviolence #trauma #metoo #speakup #standup #change

text:
#noticiasev 
la entrega de los premios #nobel de 2018 comienza el lunes con las recompensas científicas, sin el de #literatura, aplazado hasta el próximo año a raíz de un escándalo de abusos sexuales relacionado con la academia sueca.

la institución, que recibió numerosas críticas por premiar al cantante estadounidense #bobdylan en 2016, anunció a primeros de mayo que el galardón de literatura de 2018 se entregará junto al de 2019.

el origen del escándalo es el francés jean-claude arnault, al que 18 mujeres acusaron de violación o agresiones sexuales en noviembre de 2017, unas semanas después de las denuncias contra el productor de cine estadounidense #harveyweinstein, que originaron el movimiento #metoo.

la polémica ha provocado la renuncia de ocho de los 18 miembros de la academia, que se quedó por tanto sin el quorum de 12 personas necesario para funcionar.

fuente: @swissinfo.ch
.

#evnews #suecia #escándalo

text:
~tw: rape mention~
alright so i watched the kavanaugh hearing today and let me just say it’s remarkably brave of dr. ford to come forward, in a world where victim blaming and victim ignoring is all too common, can we all just applaud her? 
i’m thoroughly disgusted with kavanaugh’s behavior, denying allegations is one thing, calling it a scam is a whole other thing and it’s un expectable, and honestly i’m scared that a man charged with sexual assault is not only in the supreme court, but the white house. i’m grateful that i’ve never been sexually assaulted though i remember clearly many times in 7th grade year getting cat called on the regular, and it scared the hell out of me. america, do better.
#ibelieveher #metoo #timesup #enoughisenough #istandwithher

text: #mood of everyone in this office here given the #kavanaughhearings and political circus that followed. correction, of all the women in the office here. about that @lindseygrahamsc ...this isn't a game for any of us. i understand your party and the democrats may be in a "political fight" as you call it. however, politics directly impact our lives, politics aren't removed from it. so when you want to put a man accused of sexual assault onto the highest court of the land without so much so as hearing the other women, calling on mark judge and others to testify and letting the fbi do its job, understand how deeply that hurts us. understand that it makes it clear how little you care about us, how little you value our life and safety. 1 out of 3 women will be sexually assaulted in their life time, and that's only the official statistics. i am a survivor of sexual assault, according to your behavior, you wouldn't believe me if i came forward publicly today. this may not fit into your "political schedule" but guess what: sexual assault and the constant oppression, degradation and dismissal of women doesn't fit into our life! so your "political game" comes secondary to that. you're a representative of ours, you work for us. my $.79 on your dollar pays your salary. so i ask you to put all politics aside and do what's right. not for your party, not for the democratic party, but for us women. that's all this should be about. women. #metoo #believesurvivors #timesup #kavanaugh #enoughisenough #1billionrising

text:
there's been a one week delay on kavanaugh's supreme court nomination hearing!
.
.
for those not in the know, brett kavanaugh is president trump's pick for a seat on the us supreme court. recently, he has been plagued with allegations of rape. .
.
doctor christine blasey ford has leveled accusations of rape at brett kavanaugh, stating that he assualted her at a party when she was fifteen and he was a few years older.
.
.
those that doubt her story ask why she comes forward now. some have questioned her motives in coming out during the nomination hearings.  others still are alleging that dr. ford is making it all up.
.
.
luckily, this is not dr. ford's first time speaking out about her assualt or her history with brett kavanaugh. her therapist, husband and some family and friends knew of her struggles. this adds a very healthy amount of credence to her story.
.
.
what do you think? what are your thoughts? this is intended to be a free space here so please, feel free to express!!
.
.
leave your thoughts in the comments below
.
.

text:
hmmmmm what should i rant about today?? so many things to choose from, honestly. lol. i laugh, but it’s actually not funny at all. •
•
maybe today i won’t rant at all. maybe today i will just offer my support and my love to all of those women (and men) too scared to speak up (not to even mention report) sexual harassment, sexual assault, or rape for fear of not being believed. i believe you, i am here for you, i will stand with you. •
•
we talk about love, inclusion, support and just how generally amazing our dance community is, as though its immune from the realities of society and the world at large. i’m calling bullsh*t. seriously, boundaries are crossed every day in this community in countless ways. i know.  trust me. i know. we stay quiet because of fear. fear of judgement, that we won’t be believed, or that in some way we brought it upon ourselves. no. more. this community needs to be held accountable just like all communities need to be held accountable. what’s more, individuals need to be held accountable and responsible for their actions. •
•
i know i haven’t spoken about my own experiences publicly, but this is the best i can do for now. 
please know that i am here for you. i believe you. i stand with you. and as much as my stomach is churning right now, if this post helps even one person, it was worth it. now is not the time for silence. #metoo #standup #speakup #ibeliveyou #ibelieveford

text:
speaking up doesn't always feel good & it doesn't always feel right. like my half-monstera monstera leaf, i feel conflicted.

during this time of women/minority empowerment, the #metoo mvmt, & the wake of the kavanaugh hearings, we can hope that respectable white men would challenge themselves to be more aware of how they speak/act around women/others. perhaps this is true for some but today at a kickboxing class, i was personally reminded that many white men continue to hold onto their privilege w great vigor.

for the entire class, this man was *the only* person complaining, constantly/audibly w. "jesus christ", "this is ridiculous" & "i'm not doing this" in addition to stopping to chat w the instructor. so i spoke up, hoping my jovial tone would just make him realize he wasn't the only one in the room. instead, i woke the beast (in blue). 🔹why don't u just move somewhere else if being myself is bothering you?
🔸i'm not going to do that.
🔹i think u should just go to another spot since i'm clearly bothering you.
🔸it's difficult to take class when u are complaining loudly. if u don't want to do the workout you don't have to be here. i'm not moving.
🔹wow, u shouldn't speak to random people with such an attitude. you can't tell me what i'm allowed to say.
🔸(i don't respond)
🔹you must not have a boyfriend, no guy would ever like that kind of attitude.
🔸damn, that got personal.
🔹(stands up, yelling) well u definitely don't have a bf, there's no way!
🔸that's none of your business.
🔹i never asked, i don't care. i'm just saying u don't have one and u probably never will!
🔸i hope u don't always talk to women this way.

he yells more & storms to the opposite side of the gym. i said nothing else, neither did the teacher. when class ended, i put in my headphones to keep practicing, knowing he was shit talking me.

i am embarrassed for causing a scene. my chest burns w. frustration & my stomach has been in knots all day. i don't believe my speaking up has made him reflect on his own temperament, which he so willingly lay to bare. it might be that me challenging his blind entitlement & disregard for others will make him defend  his privilege w more aggression 😖.

text: these hearings have brought up so much pain and heartache from our collective pasts. but it’s so important that we stand up for each other and give voices to the voiceless in this never ending fight for the most basic of human rights. like so many of my friends, #metoo has directly impacted my life and my journey and i was only able to make it through because of the strength of my friends and mentors like @jensypics123. this email from her today made me cry and made me proud, in equal measure. i hope to one day be able to provide even a fraction of the support she gave me to someone else in need. but i also hope that one day i’ll never, ever, ever have to. i love you, baby jenny, my forever friend #ibelievechristineblaseyford #believewomen #strongertogether #whyididreport #tqm

text: isn't this the truth? but, it doesn't have to be this way. we are all conditioned by our parents, families and immediate societies to act, think and live in a certain way that is deemed popular/successful but which can be detrimental to our collective values and humanity. pointing fingers on the outcomes of this conditioning may raise awareness but be will not help to correct the overreaching problems. indeed, we are all responsible for our societies and how we contribute to the change or the reinforcent of the status quo of our cultures. the good news is that the current  younger millennials are really the catalysts for the changes we need towards fewer divisions and greater global harmony (especially when it comes to gender issues and equality). for example, in my journey meeting young college women and men in india and strong, empowered women in ghana, i have tremendous hope! some of the most compassionate, respectful, educated and loving young men i've ever met come from india (contrary to what one would think, given that the west is lauded for its gender equality), while some of the hardest-working, outspoken and strongest women i've met were ghanaian. what we can do as friends, family and parents is to nurture our loved ones and hold them accountable for their behavior (especially our men). we can be examples of social standards that we desire to see and take hold in society. ultimately, we are all responsible for our collective values, social norms and cultural standards. let's do our part!! #socialchange #metoo #webelievesurvivors #genderequality #empowerment #culture #parenting #womeninspiringwomen #collectiveconsciousness #thefuture #equality #justice #values #men #millenials

it’s not my country but it is our fight. god forbid this happens to you, it’s your word against his. then people don’t believe you? because you were traumatised and didn’t speak out immediately? you will not only have suffered assault, but a second assault by being doubted and “annihilated”. #ibelieveher #metoo #endvictimblaming 
#repost @glamourmag with @get_repost
・・・
"don't look away from me. you're telling me that my assault doesn't matter... that's what you're telling me when you vote for him." earlier this morning, two sexual assault survivors, ana maria archila & maria gallagher, confronted senator #jeffflake earlier this morning after he announced his plans to back judge #brettkavanaugh. tap the #linkinbio for details.

text:
absolutely lost for words right now...a friend of mine has taken a year to find her voice and words to describe what was done to her. she has found the courage to tell the world her heartbreaking story. my heart aches for her and my heart is angry with the world. how could a person actively chose to hurt another- on multiple levels? 
i can’t do anything to change the past as much as i deeply wish i could. but i can help try and change the future. i can keep the discussion going. i can listen without judgement, empower, and love unconditionally! we can be her tribe. 
if you are going through something similar i want you to know..please please please do not let this define you! you matter! your words matter and when and if you need us, your tribe is here for you! 
#metoo

text: having an untamed and defiant kind of day...i see my foremothers in the map of my freckles, the flecks in my eyes, and the waves in my hair.  this face came through generations of scots and irish women, came across the sea to america, and has been part of her history for 409 years. this is the face of a woman who, like her mothers before her, will. not. be. silenced. and i will stand with any and all of my sisters. #phoebenyx #scotsirish #descendedfromcolonials #neverthelessshepersisted #istandwithsurvivors #iam1in5 #metoo #believewomen

text:
i woke today with a heavy heart- a similar feeling to that on the morning of november 9th, 2016.
after watching 6 of the 8 hours of the hearing yesterday, my heart sank dreading we wouldn’t get the outcome we wanted. though inspired, brought to tears, and blown away by dr. christine blassey ford’s bravery, courage, and honesty, i was struck with despair when i soon realized that kavanaugh- in all his outrageous anger, aggression, and persistence of ‘innocence’- could still be confirmed.
in times like these, it is so easy to feel hopeless, unimportant, and burdened by a system that doesn’t look out for the rights’ of its individuals. where is the justice?
i’m here today not to go into detail about my story, but rather to remind all survivors and supporters that your voice matters. we cannot let this system defeat us into thinking that there’s nothing more we can do. it is important- now more than ever- that we speak up. don’t let your voice be silenced. we want to hear you; we need to hear you.
to my fellow survivors: you are not alone, i love you, i believe you, i am here for you. we have to stand together and continue to expose the injustice and carry the conversation.
share your story, even though it might be the scariest thing you’ve ever had to do.
#metoo #metoomovement #stopkavanaugh #believethewomen #believewomen #coresist

text:
i’ve struggled deciding whether or not to watch the hearing. through the me too movement, and now this - survivors of sexual harassment and assault have had to relive their past traumas. ⠀
⠀
i’m so proud of dr. ford for speaking up - that is understandably terrifying. i do not even feel comfortable discussing my past harrassments with most people. it’s so hard to put all of this into words - but it comes down to this - believe survivors.⠀
⠀
i believe her.
⠀
photo credit @mandymooremm⠀

text:
not the usual kind of thing i post on social media and it's actually really nerve-inducing but i feel it's important so here it goes...
yesterday while out running with my dog i was sexually assaulted. as i bent down to pick up after ted a man came up behind me and grabbed my bum. as i turned round to ask him what he was doing he laughed and started coming closer so i turned and ran like fuck home. it was incredibly scary and not an experience anyone prepares you for. i'm sharing my experience in the hope that others will be able to come forward if the same thing happens to them. 
the incident has been reported to the police. 
#metoo #believewomen #itsneverok #irefusetobeavictim #nopityrequired #stopdisrespectingwomen

text:
so much smudging today, cuz yesterday was painful. i didn’t think i was going to watch and then i did. i woke up feeling very weary. this energy is ancient and heavy. i am present to all the times in my life that i’ve felt objectified, preyed upon, belittled, scoffed at, unsafe, like my mere existence meant that i owed him something, feared for my life, touched, groped, yelled at, harassed, assaulted, and blamed myself for being in the wrong place at the wrong time, and on and on... i keep thinking i’ve healed, i’ve moved past it, i’m a different person now, with a totally different life... and then the old paradigm of fear and intimidation rears it’s aging head and i remember, oh yes, there is more healing to do. there’s still... more... healing... to do.

i don’t normally share about these things, but my days of being quiet and shy are over. i need to speak my truth. as painful as it was, i’m so grateful to dr. ford for sharing her story. the world needs all of our voices to be heard. despite the insanity that we see being displayed today, i can feel in my bones that we are in the midst of a major shift in collective consciousness. i pray that i am right. sending so much love to everyone that was triggered yesterday and to everyone who is committed to creating a safe and compassionate world. 🙏❤️ #metoo #smashthepatriarchy #believesurvivors #speakyourtruth

text:
the only lie a woman will tell is that it didn’t happen, when it did.
•
the only lie a woman will tell is that she’s fine, when she’s not.
•
the only lie a woman will tell is a lie that covers the ass of the man who took advantage of her - and left her with a lifetime of internal chaos and doubt and fear - because she knows he was hurting.
•
but we’re done. we’re done covering asses. we’re done staying silenced by those who molest, abuse, and suffocate us, physically, mentally, emotionally, and societally.
•
we’re done.
•
thank you dr. ford. thank you for breaking the wall of silence down. a wall that’s suffocated every woman’s innate feminine knowing - locking it away as too much, or not allowed, and all together dangerous.
•
thank you for speaking in the most inconvenient time, because you knew what the future could hold if you didn’t. for breaking our collective silence and asking for better. for putting your life and safety at risk for all of your sisters.
•
there is nothing more difficult than to speak the words of a moment when a hand was placed over your mouth and your body pushed into submission to a man. nothing.
•
nothing is more difficult than admitting your pain, your anxiety, your quirks and seemingly irrational requests, admitting they stem from a moment burned into your memory, a moment when everything in you was taken, and you’re just trying to convince yourself it’s still there.
•
thank you, dr. ford, for reminding us that in order to get those parts of us back, we must give voice to the truth - the truth that it did happen.
•
thank you for reminding us to demand. to use the fire of our years of silence to demand better. demand the institutions that have the power to make sure better is done, that they step the fuck in and do it.
•
demand the use of the societal advantage & privilege be used not to manipulate, monopolize and capitalize, but to put in place systems, practices, and laws of integrity that protect, honor, and liberate women - the sacred bearers of the future of all humanity.
•
women, we no longer tell the lie that it didn’t happen. we tell the truth that it happened, and that we’re invincible and relentless for justice because of it

text_retweet: i was sexually assaulted summer 2007, as a teen might i say i was not the most well behaved, so one day in my senior year of high school i decided to leave a class early, i had early dismissals that day so i remember it was around noon that i drove home. i clicked the garage button on my sun visor and i proceeded to pull the car into the garage. i remember i pulled in on the left side of the garage due to my car door hitting the wall, as i stepped out of my car there stood a boy, not even a foot away from me. i was trapped. i thought myself a hippie so i had no underwear on that day for some reason, he stuck his hand down my pants and continued to assault me, he whispered in my ear and said “you’re going to give me that pussy”. i screamed and punched and kicked at him. i think my fight spooked him because he ran out of the garage, i slammed the car door and quickly shut the garage. i called my mom who was at work and felt the most nausea i had ever felt in my life. i was trembling and my heart was racing as i told her, she insisted i call 911 so i did. as the 2 male police officers asked me “how many fingers was it exactly” and then joked about something non related i had never felt so alone. still to this day i check around my car to see if anyone is around as i get in or out. a sense of paranoia comes after being sexually assaulted. and it doesn’t matter how long ago it happened! this is a real struggle for women and i’ve contemplated for a long time to share my story, but there is no right time because reliving it is painful for all who have been raped, or assaulted. if you have suffered at the hands of someone who thinks they are entitled to your body know you are not alone! #ibelieveher #metoo #itstopsnow #womensempowerment #stronger #mybody #forgivness #speakup #keepyourhandsoffme #fucksexualassualt #believewomen #changehappensnow #nomore #itsawomansworldtoo #itsaboutcharacter #picksomeoneelse #isthisamerica #standtogether #picrepost

text: ‪it is high time to start pointing out the destructive history of angry white men and their fake tears and real shouts. all those powerful and patriarchal and racist white men who have presented themselves as victims of plots to take them down, meaning taking down their freedom to assault us, to rule u.s.‬ to understand american history is to understand the sensational fairytales of white male victimhood where the victimizers are the victims and the victims are the victimizers.‬ when they snatched the liberty from black people they presented themselves as victims of british snatchers of their liberty. when they enslaved people they presented themselves as victims of those resisting their enslavement. when they raped enslaved black women, they presented themselves as victims of black women’s advances. when they stole native american land they presented themselves as victims of native people fighting for their land. when they violently resisted reconstruction, they presented themselves as victims of black politicians.‬ when they disenfranchised, they presented themselves as victims of suffragists. when they segregated america, they presented themselves as victims of civil rights activists. when they mass incarcerated and deported millions, they presented themselves as victims of criminals. when their officers recklessly killed, they presented themselves as victims of the defenders of black lives. when women started saying #metoo, they presented themselves as victims of a mass conspiracies. and too many times, non-white men and women have believed their victimhood. history does not just repeat. history devastates until we devastate their power to reinforce their power on the claims of victimhood.‬

text: 3 months before i turned 17, my virginity was stolen from me. a part of me i held so dear was stripped from my being against my will. i wasn’t attacked by a stranger behind the bush — it was a young man who was then my best friend. i repeatedly verbalized the word “no” and told him how uncomfortable he was making me. i slapped his face and made attempts to scratch him with my free arm hoping that i could cause enough resistance to deter him from holding me there. instead, he laughed and told me, “you don’t know how long i’ve been waiting to have you alone so i could do this.” i started crying and tried to yell for help. he then used his elbow to hush me and began penetration. there was no alcohol/illicit drugs involved by either myself or the perpetrator — he did this fully aware of his actions. that day i was wearing solid blue jeans, and a green long-sleeve shirt which did not expose my midriff nor my breasts. there was no indication that i was “asking for it.” when the act was over, i could have called the police but, i did not. when his parents came home, i could have told them but, i did not. i did tell 2 friends and 1 family member less than 4 days afterward. from 1 “friend,” i was accused of cheating on my boyfriend — i had been dating the same person for nearly a year prior to this event. from the other “friend,” i received nothing short of an interrogation. she asked me if i was drunk, what i was wearing, if i had told him that i wasn’t interested, and she even went so far as to accuse me of making it up because at the time, she was romantically interested in this individual. after telling the family member, i was made to go to the local hospital to have a rape kit performed so that there was physical evidence to press charges, even though i had made it clear that that was not what i wanted to do. it would have become international news. despite the provider being hospitable, i found the kit to be no less intrusive than rape itself. the entire time in the room, i was angry, hurt, confused, and most of all, scared. i cried. a lot. i asked the nurse questions like, “how am i going to tell my boyfriend?” and “do i have to tell anyone?” #metoo #unreported

text:
notes on surviving sexual trauma and why some of y’all need to shut the entire fuck up. i have time today. 
dear survivors,
i believe you. you don’t have to give me any details and i still believe you. it wasn’t your fault. your very existence is revolutionary.  i’m so glad that we are surviving. i know the burden of survival feels shitty sometimes and yet, here we are. we survived. 
the hardest part about surviving sexual trauma is not surviving. 
if someone breaks into your neighbors house and robs them, do y’all automatically ask why they ain’t have an alarm system? why weren’t they home? if not, shut the fuck up. 
there is nothing that survivors could have done to prevents assaults from happening. rapist and abusers are soley responsible for preventing them. 
the hardest part is forgiving yourself for the things that you had to do in order to survive, 
learning to be gentle with yourself and trust  your body, again. because for some extended period of time, we usually blame ourselves for our bodies natural responses to trauma (fight, flight or freeze). it wasn’t our fault. 
the hardest part is coping with an intrusion of your person and having someone leave you with bodily traumatic memory that will likely consume your life. that’s work that we didn’t ask for. so not only am i left to deal with the shit that’s stored in my body, i have to work through the psychological consequences of surviving. 
here’s a holy fuck you to anybody that: 
1) victim blames 2)encourages survivors extend compassion to abusers. 3) has any unsolicited say about what a survivor should’ve done, how the should’ve responded, or has anything to say about some shit that has nothing to do with them, especially, if their intentions are to interrogate survivors and not abusers. 
stop telling people that oppressive  bullshit about god wanting to make them stronger and affirming that any of their traumas where meant to be a part of their life stories. god did not warrant such abuse upon their beloved. god does warrant their survival. #ibelievesurvivors #metoo #ihadtime #rape #sexualtrauma #isurvived

text:
i’m pissed. and if you’re a woman, or a decent dude you should be pissed too. this isn’t just voting a man into a position where he’ll be in power forever, this is about how our senate, who is made up of almost all white privileged men, are still voting in this %^*@sucker. 
well the time is now. change is upon us. we must look to our fellow sisters and brothers to say no more. times up! let’s raise our voices, fight together in unity and vote in people that will make our world a better, safer, sustainable place for our children.
#stopkavanaugh #thefutureisfemale 
#metoo #timesup

text:
~raise your hand if you need jesus~ 
new blog post... full link in bio 
there are some days in history that i clearly remember where i was. for some, it was the kennedy assassination. (i am a tad young for that.) for most of us it’s september 11th 2001.  9/11—  i will always remember where i was that day. i also remember where i was the day the space shuttle crashed in ‘86 with a teacher on board, and random things like watching the news when elvis presley died on a rainy day in august because it was my 8th birthday.

today my husband is having shoulder surgery and i am sitting in a small waiting room watching the judge kavanaugh/christine ford sexual assault hearing. i will always remember where i was on this day. 
some things just stick with you.

i have written before that i am a rape and sexual assault survivor.  i remember those days as well. i was 15 and then 19.  some of the detail escape me. alcohol, trauma, and 30 years will do that to a person for sure! at the time, a cloudy memory and my own doubts and fears kept me from coming fully forward and prosecuting with what i knew to be the truth. some people believed me and others didn’t.  all of this, the events, the attackers, and my own emotions, haunted me for years. i drank, i rebelled, i sinned, i ran, i made jokes, but nothing silenced my torment until the day i gave my life to jesus. november 17, 1992 ~read the full blog.... link in bio~ 
#metoo #jesussaves #survive #thrive
name: Tami Overhauser

text:
recent news have you feeling triggered? @mwachicago invites you to join 2 mental health experts for a free online discussion forum, "coping with #metoo". .
.
.
**rukhsana iqbal shamsi md is a physician practicing adult psychiatry in hinsdale, il and general pediatrics in hammond, in. she has 14 years of experience. she is board-certified in family medicine, psychiatry and consult-liaison psychiatry. .
.
.
**shannon b mccray lpc is a licensed professional counselor originally from new jersey, but now residing in chicago. in terms of treatment, she specializes in women's issues, substance abuse, culturally competent care, trauma counseling and correctional mental health.
.
.
.

topics to be covered: self-care, how to cope with triggers, how to help others, ptsd, taking back control of your life and mind.

there will time for discussion post presentations:
questions to the speakers are requested to be submitted beforehand via: 
bit.ly/discussionqs

registration is not required. all are welcome. 
please join in to the discussion by visiting link in profile

bit.ly/copingforum

please share widely to all who may benefit.

#believesurvivors #strongertogether #stillwerise

text: cw/tw. yesterday i realized for the first time i’m a #metoo. in case anyone is under the impression that certain kinds of women are somehow inherently exempt from this shit, i want to make it clear: sexual assault and rape culture impacts every last one of us. it’s no wonder it took me 20 years to realize that when i said i didn’t want something that should have been enough. i was never traumatized by the event, i didn’t really think much of it actually. in fact, i sort of figured the assault didn’t count or that i sort of asked for it by taking the cross-wearing self-identified texas christian fuckface home in the first place. he argued with my reasons for not wanting to hook up with him, “proceeded” anyway, eventually stopped and told me i was rude to make him sleep on the couch. i was 19 and couldn’t understand why i didn’t actually want to hook up with dudes when it came down to it, being the totally repressed and self loathing queer that i was i figured there was something wrong with me. but no fucking wonder i didn’t think it was a big deal, because it’s just the norm and we humiliate and shame and threaten women who aren’t 100% available for men to do whatever they want with then throw away the next day save maybe sending some nudes around if they were fortunate enough to slip a roofie in there and snap a photo to show off to their frat bros. there’s no such thing as being a m*n hater. possibly every single woman i’ve ever met has been assaulted by one. just call us scientists, who look at the overwhelming numbers in an infinite sample set and, despite popular belief, use our rational brains to identify who the predatory group is. for all of those hashtagnotallmen types out there, awesome, i can’t wait for y’all to be the ones correcting, condemning, calling out, and punishing rape culture amongst yourselves because women are so fucking tired of having to do it. i cannot wait for history to crucify the current members of the republican party and all of the brainswashed supporters who aren’t protesting against their horrendous elected officials. #believesurvivors #ibelieveanitahill #ibelievechristineblaseyford #destroythepatriarchy #metoo

text: to say i’m disgusted is the truth. to say that i’m shocked... well... i’m not. we are women living in america. this is a path so many of us are all too familiar with. we brave hell to share our experiences, and are greeted with threats, name-calling, invalidation, and victim blaming. they may not believe us. but our stories matter. we are valuable. and we are survivors. build up a fellow warrior today, and every day. we are always stronger together. #believesurvivors #survivor #warrior #sexualassault #metoo #strongertogether

text:
there is a box is how i describe it.  a box where the stuff of nightmares is kept. 
it is taped securely shut & stored out of the light in the back of my mind. 
sometimes a smell, a sound, a touch or sensation will cause the box to explode open forcing one or more of several nightmares to pop out. unexpectedly.  catching me off guard.  knocking the wind out of me. the ptsd switch turned on.  survival mode kicked in to hyper drive.  sometimes i fight to keep from falling to the ground a sobbing mess, others i find my fists clenched ready to swing. 
other times events pick pick pick at the tape keeping that box shut.  that spot becomes slowly irritated and allows fear, anger, rage, pain both physical and emotional, amongst others to seep out. it feels as though i am being slowly suffocated. 
i’ve always said i will shout my story from the rooftops if it will help others. i will do what i can to help someone make the step from victim to survivor.  i needed that & didn’t have it.  i had to do it alone, scared, bandage my own wounds.  these last few days i have watched as one facebook friend after another have posted their story & i want to hug each & every one, because #metoo.  what has been the most difficult, though, is seeing some of the sickening comments, not just from men...but other women.  i can’t even begin to comprehend how some can be so cruel & cold. victim shaming & accusing.  i’m without words, & yet not, the behavior of a person close to me that adds another dimension to all of this.  a part of my story i struggle with the timing of sharing.  a part of the story incomprehensible & controversial that needs to be brought to the surface.  the tape holding my box shut being picked at.  i am a survivor of molestation, rape, assault.  #believesurvivors i don’t want to tell my story for attention, because every time i tell it, it means the box gets unsealed.  on the flip side, as the mom of 2 sons, i have worried about the ‘ what if’ some girl might make false accusations.  i don’t know what else to add.  it’s not the end of my story, just the end of this post.  #istandwithchristineblaseyford

text: let us remember: not all survivors of rape and sexual assault are women! there are survivors of all genders, races, ages and abilities. as many of you know, i am survivor. there are some days when i don’t really think about it at all, and other days when i think about it constantly. i always think that i am no longer emotionally attached to my trauma, until something like this happens and a survivor’s validity and credibility are put into question (pretty much strictly by people who have never experienced it). then everything comes flooding back. sexual assault doesn’t just exist in that moment, it lives alongside you for the rest of your life. it impacts your mental and physical health, your friendships, familial bonds and romantic relationships. when you defend brett kavanaugh and call dr. blasey ford a liar, you’re not simply voicing an opinion. you are hurting all of us in a very direct way. accusations like these are in immediate correlation with why so many assaults go unreported. because we are afraid for our safety, because we are afraid of police, because we are afraid nothing will be done, because we are afraid people won’t believe us. and in our current climate, belief is no longer enough. we need your support, because with momentum, we can make big changes. (note: i made this drawing)

text: the kavanaugh hearings have been triggering. each time new allegations of assault are made, survivors relive their own trauma in ways that are unseen by others. for those who could relate to dr. christine blasey ford yesterday, we watched in anticipation with hope that some semblance of justice would be served on behalf of all survivors who have been denied in the past. for me, her courage gave me the strength to finish the story of my assault that i’ve been trying to write for the past two and a half years. • in my first editorial piece for vice @broadly, i described the reasons why some people choose not to report their assault. though fear of being shamed and stigmatized are most common, for me it was an opportunity to reclaim my power, to release myself of being labeled a victim and become the woman i had always wanted to be. • as ford has shown us, just because an assault goes unreported doesn’t make it less real. we are far from living in a world where survivors can feel safe about reporting their assaults. until we get there, we need to take it upon ourselves to serve as allies to survivors, regardless of if they choose to report or not. • special thanks to my incredible editors amy rose spiegel and lindsay schrupp for their monumental support in helping me craft this piece. to my j-baes, @apatheticfemme and @anjali_nayar, thank you for encouraging me to tell my story and reminding me it's okay to be vulnerable while being strong. • link in bio
name: Alliey Lau

text: posted this once before. seems like a good time to do so again...too many people acting like it's men v. women. an unhealthy and unwise viewpoint. those of you who know there are worlds unseen (magnetic field, spirit, atomic, etc) should also know there are forces unnamed that ceaselessly sow division. the game is older than you realize, both men & women are harmed by it, and we are not on a path to resolving it right now. divided we fall. stop eating toxic crap that clouds the mind! shut that tv and phone off and elevate your capacity to contemplate! #real #truth #now #gylany #nyc #bethechange #metoo

text: #viceonhbo has been working on this episode for months...a special focused on the very difficult conversations surrounding sexual consent. it lands during a week where all of us are watching an extraordinary political drama unfold in washington, centered upon the very issues we tackle in our episode; consent, sexual assault, trauma and the shockwaves in a culture grappling with how to productively move forward in the #metoo era. the team responsible for this work handled it with sensitivity and respect. @izyeung @jackie.jesko @holleratchasoy @joelittlemountain @carina.mia @chasenyc @daniel_hollis_af @jakesterb @low_pez @rylans @chloechamps and so many more. i hope you'll watch tonight.

text:
together, we can be the generation to ensure that #sheisequal.

one thing that has been made crystal clear in the last 18 months: women and girls deserve, and now demand, to be treated as equals. this has played out in the #metoo and shedecides movements to safeguard the sexual and reproductive health and rights of women; with an increased recognition of women as leaders for empowerment and gender equality, and a renewed focus on how women and girls are treated differently in every aspect of life — in school, by governments, by health systems, and in the workplace. today, citizens around the world are standing up for female empowerment and gender equality to ensure health, education and opportunity for girls and women everywhere.

because we know that when girls and women are empowered — when she is equal — she can get an education, decide when to get married and start a family, and get proper healthcare.

take action to ensure that #sheisequal #bethegeneration

text:
violence against women is not innate. it is learned behavior through systems like patriarchy, misogyny, and misogynoir. it’s reinforced in subtle ways and portrays women as lying and manipulative individuals seeking to gain something. statistically, 2-8% of sexual violence claims are determined to be false. conversely over 90% of perpetrators of sexual violence are never held responsible for their violent actions. it’s way past time to believe women. the time is up for men like kavanaugh, cosby, weinstein, and r. kelly. the time is also up for that uncle, cousin, deacon, pastor, teacher,or coach that no one wants to talk about. we can do better. we should better. we must do better. if you’d like to find out how you can support survivors of sexual violence feel free to click the link in my bio.
.
.
.
.
#metoo #timesup #believesurvivors #believewomen #domesticviolenceawareness #yeahthatgreenville

text:
he said, "you've gotten tough"
'cause my tone was curt.
yeah and when i'm approached in a dark alley,
i don't lift my skirt.
in the city, self-preservation is a full time occupation.
i'm determined to survive on this shore. 
you know i don't avert my eyes anymore.
in a man's world, i am a woman by birth. 
and after nineteen times around, 
i have found they will stop what you are worth.
talk to me now.
i played the powerless in too many dark scenes,
and i was blessed with a birth and a death,
and i guess i just wanted some say in between. 
don't you understand? 
in the day to day and the face to face, 
i have to act just as strong as i can 
just to preserve a place where i can be who i am. ~ani 💜💜💜 sisters, aunties, mamas, grandmas. i’m lovin you, crying with you, making you tea, hearing your truths, feeling you..... believing you. i circled back today to  draw strength from this fierce little lyndsey who learned the hard way how to protect herself, like so many of us. fell into an ani rabbit hole that ended up in heartbroken open tears and prayers.... feeling so much sacred gratitude and devotion and protection for the bravery and witness of christine. feeling so much deep trust and knowing of the shapeshifting that is happening culturally as we face and molt the terror and shame of sexual violence. revisiting my own courtroom finding-my-voice moment, forgiving and calling in my attacker. brothers, fathers, lovers, uncles..... listen to us. listen deeper. ask us what we need. love us so well right now. let your hearts break open from our nightmares, help us metabolize the fear and heal and create safe space for us to come again into our voice and power. and please. get support because you been traumatized too otherwise this shit would not be happening. circle up with each other, find your men’s group, figure out who and how..... get vulnerable, confess, learn to cry again, be forgiven, receive help, grow up. ✨✨✨bless up the love we are when we are free. it’s happening. grieve, get loose. rinse, repeat. i love you. we got this. #loveisall #ibelieveher #metoo #paradigmshift #divinefemininerising

text:
москва, 28 сен — риа новости. пользователи соцсетей осудили наряд голливудской актрисы алиссы милано, которая пришла на слушания в cенате сша, где разбирался иск о сексуальных домогательствах бретта кавано по отношению к кристин блейзи форд.

женщина во время марша против сексуальных домогательств в голливуде, сша
"цена карьеры — секс": в сша "сильные женщины" жалуются на домогательства
кристин форд ранее обвинила кандидата в верховный суд сша в домогательствах, которые, по ее словам, имели место более 30 лет назад во время обучения в университете.

алисса милано была в числе первых голливудских звезд, начавших борьбу с сексуальными домогательствами. именно она запустила флешмоб #metoo, в котором женщины рассказывали о том, как они сталкивались с харассментом.

пользователи twitter посчитали наряд актрисы слишком вызывающим. ​"как можно воспринимать всерьез то, как оделась алисса милано на слушания? сколько неуважения с этим распахнутым декольте", — написал @kimpoises. "ей нужно показать еще более глубокое декольте", — отметил @mikejbarnes. "это так по-голливудски с ее стороны", — написал @dasbat81.
name: СЕРГЕЙ БАССЕЙН

text:
the hill-thomas hearings persist in the american consciousness as a watershed moment for partisanship, for male entitlement, for testimony on sexual misconduct, for intra-racial tension and interracial affiliation. the ford-kavanaugh hearings will be remembered for their entrenchment of the worst impulses from that earlier ordeal. what took place on thursday confirms that male indignation will be coddled, and the gospel of male success elevated. it confirms that there is no fair arena for women’s speech. mechanisms of accountability will be made irrelevant. some people walked away from 1991 enraged. the next year was said to be the year of the woman. our next year, like this one, will be the year of the man. - doreen st. felix, the new yorker 📷 @vogue 
#believesurvivors #metoomovement #metoo #whyididntreport #ibelieveher #timesup #believewomen #survivor #christineblaseyford #womensupportingwomen

text:
sexual assault survivor confronts jeff flake on cnn: ‘don’t look away from me’. two sexual assault survivors confronted sen. jeff flake (r-ariz.) on live tv friday, shortly after the senator announced he would vote to confirm supreme court nominee brett kavanaugh.

the senator had just announced he would vote to confirm supreme court nominee brett kavanaugh.“you’re telling all women that they don’t matter,” said one woman between tears as flake tried to leave in an elevator with his head down. “look at me when i’m talking to you!” she shouted. “you’re telling me that my assault doesn’t matter.” “look at me and tell me that it doesn’t matter what happened to me!” the woman added. “that you’ll let people like that go into the highest court in the land and tell everyone what they can do with their bodies.” https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/jeff-flake-cnn-protester-kavanaugh_us_5bae303be4b0425e3c22e899

#ibelievechristineblaseyford #metoo #imwithher #unitedstates #imwithher #women #enoughisenough #cnn #vote #iwillvote #democrats #strongertogether #onwardtogether #loveandkindness #resist #respect #neverforget #neveragain

text: this is me putting war paint on my face 👁this is my contribution today. i decided to make art. it’s my personal form of rebellion. this week has been very hard. it’s brought up a lot. but it’s a conversation we need to be having. it’s long overdue. to all my sisters (and brothers) who are hurting, i stand with you. we are united. we will fight and we will win. we are the revolution and you will hear us roar. xoxo ao ps this is one of the new tunes! i wrote it with the very talented @ddbowes #metoo #noh8 #yassqueen #ibelieve #ibelieveher #ibelieveyou #ao #ibeleiveinmiracles #no #soundon🔊

text:
so i guess what i’m wondering right now besides things like how to power the eastern seaboard with my rage and where the nearest krav maga class is for my little girls, is what men who attend and run spiritual men’s groups are doing to address sexual violence and rape culture as it shows up in their circles.

i have a few things to ask of these men. but first:

y’all need to understand that every room you walk into has survivors [and abusers] in it. the stats are well documented and are known to be lower than actual occurrence. it is a given.

it is a given that any group of men contains men who have committed sexual violence and/or have colluded with it. there is literally no sector or demographic that is exempt from this pervasive and omnipresent rape culture.

it’s not over there, in washington. or in hollywood. or in silicon valley. 
it is everywhere and it is epidemic.

and i’m seeing a pattern of pushback, denial, and avoidance when these white, male, spiritual, “village-minded” and heavily credentialed leaders are confronted with questions about how they’re dealing with the men in their groups who have done harm.

i have heard first-hand accounts of men showing up who are known abusers to men’s circles and the leader claimed to have “no idea what to do.” i saw this question asked of a prominent white author and leader of circles of “healing” say “my cis male friends are too witchy and queer to be like that...socially i’m in kind of a bubble.” like, dude, did you just nimby the #metoo movement because you think nobody in your close friends circle could have ever done such a thing?

bro, do you even math??? neurodivergent queer witches, radical anarchists, male feminists, fathers with “strong wives and daughters” violate consent and fuck their students/fans/babysitters/those with less power all the time. 
i’m really tired of the lack of interrogation or accountability these leaders are offering their students and consumers of their books and workshops either through hyper-individualist paradigms of the “hero’s journey” and “unique genius” or through a kind of eschewing dissent under the notion of being “village-minded.” cont’d in the comments.

text:
a little snippet from today.  lots of conversation happening in this household.  thank you dr. ford. 
i think yoga is much more than just the physical practice.  for me it’s about being mindful, intentional and delving into the questions like: “who am i? what is my purpose?” more and more i feel like my voice gets stronger and my mental clarity gets sharper.  i often have a hard time articulating what truly upsets me, and have the need to sit with things until my brain has sifted through the thoughts and emotions until i can see the picture more objectively.  i’m always trying to understand my motivations, and my urges.  why the things that tigger me have such an emotional affect on my being.  searching for understanding.  feeling so many things.

and not in a pitiful way...re-reading my post i could see how it could be misconstrued.  i think we all need to be truth tellers in our lives.  find strength in ourselves to ask hard questions and seek growth.  figure out why we get upset and how to process our emotions into something actionable.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#yogaeverydamnday #questforthepress #momlife #momyoga #hardconversations #metoo #yogaforlife #yoga #upsidedown #shoulders #abs #handstanddrills

text: here are the men who voted in favor of advancing the nomination of brett kavanaugh to the supreme court.  what these men really did today was say that the word of a man is worth more than a women's.  what they did was tell every survivor that their stories don't matter.  i don't know how these men will be able to look their wives, daughters, and mothers in the eye tonight.  i will remember this come november and i hope that all of my fellow women will too. #metoo #supremecourt #sexualassault #christineblaseyford #womenstandtogether #ibelieveher #ibelievechristineblaseyford

text: my mom’s birthday is tomorrow. she would’ve been 62. she died almost 5 years ago from pancreatic cancer. my best friend sent me flowers today like she does every year. on top of that, it’s been a hard week. the news is tough to watch and i feel like my heart is raw. surround yourself with people who get you and support what you’ve been through. the world is still full of good people. don’t lose hope. ❤️ #metoo

text_retweet:
the good doctor speaks...
----
#repost @ibramxk
・・・
‪it is high time to start pointing out the destructive history of angry white men and their fake tears and real shouts. all those powerful and patriarchal and racist white men who have presented themselves as victims of plots to take them down, meaning taking down their freedom to assault us, to rule u.s.‬ to understand american history is to understand the sensational fairytales of white male victimhood where the victimizers are the victims and the victims are the victimizers.‬ when they snatched the liberty from black people they presented themselves as victims of british snatchers of their liberty. when they enslaved people they presented themselves as victims of those resisting their enslavement. when they raped enslaved black women, they presented themselves as victims of black women’s advances. when they stole native american land they presented themselves as victims of native people fighting for their land. when they violently resisted reconstruction, they presented themselves as victims of black politicians.‬ when they disenfranchised, they presented themselves as victims of suffragists. when they segregated america, they presented themselves as victims of civil rights activists. when they mass incarcerated and deported millions, they presented themselves as victims of criminals. when their officers recklessly killed, they presented themselves as victims of the defenders of black lives. when women started saying #metoo, they presented themselves as victims of a mass conspiracies. and too many times, non-white men and women have believed their victimhood. history does not just repeat. history devastates until we devastate their power to reinforce their power on the claims of victimhood.‬

text:
the fear of telling about being sexually assaulted and how the authorities will treat us. it takes tremendous courage for a survivor of sexual assault to come forward in our society.

it took me over 40 years to tell anyone about being raped and abused as a child. i most certainly would struggle to remember all of the details of 16 years of abuse. yes my mind remembers the violence, the tastes, smells and violation of my body. these memories can still trigger me at times now.

not everyone has the strength or courage to bring their sexual assault out for everyone to analyze. some survivors will never tell anyone about being sexually abused or assaulted in their life. their reasons can be for personal protection. self preservation knowing how society treats anyone who comes out publicly as being a sexual assault victim. survivors who do chose to share their story or present the assault to the authorities know that we have just placed ourselves under a microscope of judgement. every aspects of our lives will be taken apart to be analyzed as to why we were abused or assaulted. this is the very reason that we must support survivors when they come forward and we must let them know that they are not alone. we have been there. we understand and we will not turn our backs on them.

harold glen hull
sexual abuse survivor 
isuvoa.com

#sexualabuse #sexualassault #rapesurvivor #whyididntreport #storiestotell #childabusesurvivor #survival #justice ##teachersofinstagram #advocates #supportsurvivors #mentoo #metoo #metoomovement

text:
for years i have had this dream to change my life. to move forward and move on to this bigger city that has been the only place that felt where i belonged, even when visiting just for a day.
.
.
seems silly, yes? but the truth is, no dream you have is silly. treat each dream as this big, important, happy, wonderful and attainable thing. focus on it. you can make it happen.
.
.
it’s been nearly 1 year that i have been “living the dream”, and my goodness have i felt every single emotion out here, stronger than ever before, during this time. and it has been beautiful. enlightening. inspiring. empowering. good.
.
.
ever since i was little, i would stare at this building in awe. dreaming to be a part of its history and future. dreaming to see it every day. one full year of seeing it daily hasn’t gotten old yet. looking back, and looking at this photo, i feel strong. beautiful. powerful. independent. intelligent. resilient. and most importantly, proud. of myself.
.
.
with everything going on in this world, in this nation, in this city over the last year, month, week, it is very apparent how we all need more kindness. understanding. love. support. ears to listen, shoulders to cry on, hands to hold and souls to believe us. to believe in us.
.
.
i believe we can. and we will.
.
.
#iamwomanhearmeroar #bekind #metoo  #ibelieveher #ibelieveyou #loveyourself #believe #dreambig #wecandoit #standup #speakup

text: i’m 17 here and a few months later i had a traumatic experience where i ended up having to testify against my assailant and where his lawyer blamed me for wearing ‘tight’ pants that put not good thoughts in his head.  his girlfriend called and left threatening messages telling me not to testify as i was a liar. i pushed this terrible experience aside, but it never left. when #metoo came out, the memory came back and i knew i had to share.  the reason i refuse to be silent is not only that experience, but numerous other ones, including an abusive father, boyfriend ( one tried to kidnap me and force me to marry him as god told him to), and other times when strangers thought they had the right to touch me.  this is why i believe dr. ford. #believesurvivors and i will continue to speak out.

text:
to say that this kavanaugh garbage has infringed on our vacation would be an understatement.
the gop’s deference to male supremacy has left me gutted.
this key vote has broken my heart.
this entire process has stripped me of faith that the human beings that comprise the collective citizenship of this country actually matter.
it has shown me that what we have on our hands is not merely an issue of being taken for our word, but also an issue of being protected once our word is given. 
believe survivors. but also act on it.

text:
how can you stand by a man like #billcosby ? they asked me... bill cosby is paying his price for whatever he may have done but he brings great memories to me. 
but where was #metoo with bill clinton? 
were you cosby haters even born?

bill clinton, the 42nd president of the united states (1993–2001), has been publicly accused of sexual misconduct by four women: juanita broaddrick accused clinton of raping her in 1978; kathleen willey accused clinton of groping her without consent in 1993; leslie millwee accused clinton of sexually assaulting her in 1980; and paula jones accused clinton of exposing himself to her in 1991 as well as sexually harassing her. 
of all the allegations made against him, clinton has only admitted extramarital relationships with monica lewinsky and gennifer flowers, both of which have generally been accepted as consensual.

text:
the cost of trauma is high. it costs far more than just a horrifc experience.. years of therapy, broken relationships, dissasociation from life, fear of intamicy. it leads to alcohol and drug abuse, risky behavior, depression, anxiety, suicide. it plows over any boundary ever set.. just to brush the surface of long term effects. trauma goes deep into a humans soul and changes mind, body, and spirit in the blink of an eye.. someone who has been traumatized in the past is more likely to be traumatized again. we cant afford any more heartache.. humanity needs to heal. so many of our brothers and sisters are bravely sharing their stories and we can see how many of us are walking around with heaviness. its time to break the cycle.
.
.
.
please look at your life and those in your life who have gone through traumatic experience. understand the best you can. let them know you are there to listen. hug them. (your friends and yourself) love. love. love!!! (and say no to patriarchal demands) its the only way out of this mess. #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #traumatransformation #ptsd #mentalhealmatters #lovepost #healinghearts #bethechange #metoo #sistercircle. .•°
°•.
.•°
♡beautiful art borrowed from @sonaksha

text:
i’ve taken the last few days to integrate this energy and hold a big space for the collective at this time as we are clearing massive matrix programming codes of slavery, misinformation, deception and separation.
.

many have been triggered this week by events in the media that are taking place on a national stage in the united states. for many it has activated disempowerment codes of victimization, anger, resentment and disgust and if you have felt these energies arise within you you know for sure you are clearing them.
.

as agents of change of the new paradigm shift, it is up to those of us who have balanced and integrated ascension energies at this time to hold space for the collective as well as see through the deception that is currently occurring.
.

the feminine energy has been on a trajectory of healing and empowerment and she has been doing this in preparation to balance the energies on the planet at this time and it is important that we use the skills and knowledge that we have attained through our ascension process so far to remain neutral and balanced even in the face of what appears to be injustice.
.

now this doesn’t mean that we do not carefully consider and feel into the situations that arise at this time, just be careful that you are not letting your own experience of trauma or victimization color your actions at this time. this moment of clarity is asking you to use the skills that you have acquired to detach from your activated emotions and look at things objectively.👇🏻

text: this pilot is based on real life experiences of a teen girl trying to get through high school, when her world is turned upside by her first #metoo experience. it’s a, dramedy, filled with silly ridiculousness and heartfelt seriousness, just like me. while the events have changed, the story is real. it’s not only real for me, but real for all the girls who faced sexual harassment/assault on a daily bases while navigating the insanity of high school. i’m so happy it’s getting recognized! all that editing is paying off! #finaldraft #quarterfinalist #finaldraftbigbreak #amwriting #screenwriting #screenwriter #teleplay

text:
it's beyond incredible and absolutely moving to see these women speaking truth to power and checking a sitting senator for cowardly using his power to ignore and insult all victims of sexual assault everywhere. this is what true heroism and patriotism looks like

these two women should be recognized for their absolute strength, courage, and bravery. i'm pretty sure they were the catalyst that caused flake to check his conscience and change his mind to supporting an fbi investigation. as hard as all the pieces of shit in the gop tried to silence a sexual assault victim, we finally see justice for all sexual assault victims in a small but powerful way. one of the rare moments where i actually feel hope for this country 💜

i was either 3 or 4 years of age the first time that i was sexually molested.
i don't remember if it was my babysitter's son or husband who did it. i do know that it happened. i remember what i was wearing, which room we were in, how afraid i was, and what it felt like.
i told no one.
:
:
when i was 14 i was left at the home of some virtual strangers. a couple who had several children together. my mother and i were evicted from the place we were living and i was taken to live with a family i had just met. i was told that my mother was living in her car. i lived there for close to a year. the man, who was 36, began raping me shortly after i moved in. he took my virginity. the raping continued the entire time that i lived there. i can't even begin to explain what life in that house was like.
it was a nightmare even before the continual raping began.
i told no one.
i had no one to tell. i wasn't even attending school at this time, so i never even left the house.
:
:
:
i have several more personal stories of abuse and neglect...but the point is, the one time i did try to report inappropriate sexual conduct...to the police and in court...i was treated like a piece of shit.
:
everyone needs to stop fixating on how long it's been or why it was never reported.
just listen. listen to and believe women and other victims of abuse and rape.
:
:
:
#metoo #believewomen #believevictimsofabuse #listentosurvivors #timesup #femaleempowerment #useyourvoice

i told no one.

text:
the past two days have been rough.  really rough.  #christineblaseyford gave an absolutely courageous testimony.  women's voices like hers are keeping me going. 
i tried to bake french bread this morning and failed miserably.  too embarrassing for a photo. in baking and women's rights, i guess, it's try and fail and try again. 
i thought a lot about what to post and i decided on @gabriellezevin #youngjaneyoung.  it's #fiction  which is about all i can handle right now -- a beautiful and charming book chock full of women's voices in the fallout of a senator's sex scandal.  it's funny.  like really funny. 
as i finish the last round of editing on my own #metoo novel prior to pitching, i hope tomorrow is easier than the last two days. .
.
.
.
.
#bookstagram #booksandbread #booksbooksbooks #amwriting #bookstores #bibliophile #goodreads #reading #books #readersofinstagram #gabriellezevin

.

.

text: if you’ve found the last few days triggering, don’t forget to take care of yourself. maybe get a good night of sleep and sleep in tomorrow, go for a walk with a friend, eat a nourishing dinner, go to the cat cafe and kiss kitten foreheads, write down your feelings if that helps, read audre lorde, do whatever gives you a little sense of peace. take care of you. #metoo

text: feeling the call to action today! for survivors, this has been and very triggering and emotional few days. self-care is so important. please reach out to your support system. there is inevitable pain involved in healing but also an opportunity for so much growth and ultimately freedom. don’t give up or lose hope. continue on your healing journey. please do not stop telling your story! we need each other! your resilience defines your life, not your trauma. call us at triune therapy group 310-933-4088 for help finding resources local to you! #metoo #metoomovement #timesup #dtla #march #losangelos #timesupnow #believesurvivors #trauma #traumarecovery #healing #stopkavanaugh #feminist #feminism #recovery @triunetherapygroup @behindcloseddoorskabc  @kabcradio

text:
i ran today for the women who are no longer with us to run. i ran today for the survivors. i ran today for women struggling with sexual abuse; past and current. i ran today for you.
with the toxicity on the news, i needed to get away. i needed to get out. while outside, i thought of every woman i knew and her survival story. there are so many of us! i thought about my own story. i prayed that when we decide to bring a child into this world, if we have a daughter, she will not need to live in fear of her male counterparts. i prayed that if we have a son, he will know to respect another person’s body as though it is his own. we are all the same flesh. we may be into different things, but we all bleed the same. respect your body. respect my body. respect our body. it’s that simple, or at least it should be.
name: Susan 🏃🏻‍♀️ Muki 🐶
