text: i do not post political posts normally but i feel it is highly important to show my support for this individual and any other individual who has had the strength, courage, heart, and resilience to come forward about an event like this that has happened to them in their life. as a female and as a person who has been through my own experiences, i admire her immensely and i do not condone anyone that says that a survivor needs to report what happens to them immediately. i do not condone anyone that says that if an incident was that scary, they should have dealt with it already. i do not think that it is possible for people to comprehend the immense feelings that come from an experience like this. and that’s okay that they do not. but do not try to diminish how traumatic an event like this can be. i stand by #christineblaseyford and all members of the #metoo movement. ❤️

text:
he was supposed to come by this morning (since he didn’t last night) to drop off some items for the kids and didn’t show up. since he told me he was going to be here at around 11, i had made an appointment to go see a house at one. he started calling me up and playing games, trying to cause conflict and then eventually said “i can’t be near you when i feel threatened and concern for my safety” 😂 i guess me calling him out on not ever spending time with the kids was threatening? so i decided to just take the kids with me although i was going to be about an hour late to the appointment. when i walked outside he had left the groceries on the post in front of the house directly in the arizona sun but never told me👍🏼

text:
thank you, dr. christine blasey ford, for having the courage to speak your truth on behalf of us all. you had nothing to gain and everything to lose, but you did it anyway and handled it with poise & grace. you are a true hero.
.
speaking up about sexual assault is one of the hardest things i’ve ever done: the fear that no one will believe you, the doubt swarming you when your memory is hazy (or you were unconscious at the time), your perpetrator’s calculated denial. shame & guilt are enough of a barrier not to share your story. but what i will never ever forget was how deeply violated i felt and that i would never ever wish this feeling upon anyone.
.
i believe you and i stand with all survivors. our narratives matter. do not let them drown us out. ✊🏼 #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #metoo #christineblaseyford #anitahill #nofeminismnofuture #stopkavanaugh

text:
this statue, called "emptiness.” was created by a grieving parent. it is haunting, beautiful depiction of how a parent feels after losing a child.

but, as art does, it can represent many different things to different people at different times. 
for me, i can relate in a small way bc i am a parent, even though, thankfully i have my kids...but seeing this today, it also struck my heart in an additional way...how i feel about our country & democracy...about being a woman & just a human being. so much has been disgraceful & sad in the lack of humanity. (last night’s scotus hearings, some of the comments afterward, and the rush to push this through w/o more investigation being the low point.) however, this hole can be emptiness, sadness, loss, but also can be seen as possibility. things are not black or white. sit w/this image and let your feelings & thoughts flow. i am allowing my sadness & grief to come out & i chose to take action to do as much as i can to make this world a kinder, more inclusive, peaceful place...not just in my daily life—in my individual world, but by being informed & participating on a larger scale within society. if this speaks to even one of you, then sharing this is worth it. please pass it on. 💜  #winteralwaysturnstospring  #metoo  #womenandmenareequal  #humanity  #respect

text:
hey @lindseygrahamsc i’m a sc resident. went to college here, started my career, bought my first home in charleston. i love living in the state, but in this state, not that’s it’s anyone’s business & wish i didn’t feel the need to even mention it, i too like many other women have been assaulted. 
this country is not asking you as a senator to condemn this mans life for what he has very clearly done to not one woman, but potentially three separate women. but they are asking you to not elect him to the highest court of the land. 
people can change, i believe that, and people certainly make decisions they otherwise might not have when under the influence. but the fact remains those people have displayed a serious lack and dismissal of judgement and do not possess the moral compass that should be an obvious prerequisite for this position. 
he made it very clear on the stand that he does not possess the poise & self control necessary for this position. 
this man should not be making the decisions that could potentially impact the rest of my life & that of my future children. 
have some decency and change your vote for all the women that call sc home... sc ladies what do you think? maybe you should let our good old senator know. 
#metoo #thisisbullshit #whatishappeningtoourcountry

text:
“when i wrote this movie i knew i wasn’t alone, but not much had been said publicly about the trauma and troubles that survivors go through. this week, despite the powerful #metoo movement, we continue to see the fight that women have to put up in order to be believed. 
i am a survivor. i believe survivors. and i believe that having our voices and stories heard is important. i realize that a film might not be able to solve all the problems in the world but i also know that growing up, sitting in the dark watching stories unfold in front of me, i felt less afraid and more hopeful. 
representation matters. i made this film for you.”
- eva vives
name: The Orchard Films

republican sen. jeff flake, minutes after he announced he would support supreme court nominee brett kavanaugh, was confronted at the us capitol friday morning by two women who say they are sexual assault survivors. “don’t look away from me. look at me and tell me that it doesn’t matter what happened to me. that you will let people like that go into the highest court of the land,” one of the women said. flake did not address the two women’s questions directly, but said, “thank you.”

text:
trigger warning // sexual assault 
coming forward takes infinite amounts of courage. today, dr. ford has inspired millions. i believe her. i support her. and i am inspired by her to share my story. i know there will be people who will not believe me, just as there are people who do not believe her. but i do. and i want her to know that, if nothing else, her bravery will help young women like myself and many of my friends find the strength to come forward. #ibelieveher #metoo

in light of the kavanaugh hearings and dr. ford’s bravery and strength today, i want to take a moment to speak about my own experiences with sexual assault. this is something that is so impossibly hard for me to talk about, but in speaking to multiple women in my life who have gone through similar experiences and have bravely fought through the aftermath of sexual assault, i have found the strength to finally be open and honest about what i went through. first, i just want to say that i know many of my friends know and love and defended my assaulter’s actions against both myself and other individuals, which is a big part of why i didn’t openly talk about it nor label it sexual assault for so long. i don’t blame those people at all, but i do want to put that out there. for privacy purposes, i will be excluding his name in this post. for most of eighth grade, he repeatedly sexually assaulted me. the extent of these violations ranged from repeatedly groping me both in and out class, to forcing me to sit next to him on computer lab days to play “firetruck” (a game during which he’d run his hand up my thigh to my genitals, refusing to stop even when i said “red light”), to even forcing his crotch in my face in the middle of history class on multiple occasions. the assault got so bad that another student in our class - whose identity i do not know to this day - reported him to the school. the person who reported him did not mention my name, just that he was doing these things to someone in our class. rather than face any sort of consequences, my assaulter was let off with a warning. this only made things worse, as he believed i was the one who had reported him, and sought to “teach me a lesson”+
name: lex 🔭

text: for anyone else having to relive events of your past over the last few days, just know you’re not alone. it has been extremely difficult and retraumatizing for me and i’ve found that staying off of social media feeds has been helpful. “the news is not more important than your wellbeing. take care of yourself today and every day. set your boundaries and don’t let anyone judge them. and please, please, know that you are loved, supported and believed.” thank you @mspackyetti for the reminder ✨ i’m in awe of dr. ford and her strength and courage as she relives her attack in front of the entire nation. i see you, i believe you and i am with you 🖤 #metoo
name: Jasmine Briones 🍍

text:
#metoo 🤦‍♀️🙋‍♀️🇺🇸
@regran_ed from @plantbasedblonde -  today was emotionally exhausting, trying and triggering to say the least. my heart is heavy for the millions of other survivors who have had to relive their trauma as dr. christine blasey ford recounted her own. i don’t have adequate words to express the thoughts swirling in my head but know i stand with you. i believe you. your truth and stories matter, and that regardless of the outcome, as my fierce female friend @purefire said so eloquently, “each voice that comes forward adds to the collective song; we will no longer be silenced, we will not passively accept a status quo that tells us we deserve to be used and subjugated. we deserve to be safe. we deserve to be heard. we deserve justice. i see you and i hear you, my sisters. may we keep rising." #togetherwerise #believesurvivors #metoo 📸: @mollylaufman - #regrann

text:
last weekend, i had the privilege of attending the cultivate women's conference with special guest speaker, @lysaterkeurst . serving alongside some amazing women of @sandalschurch was a pleasure. lysa reminded us of god's character and how our faith must override the virtual reality of our shiny world. our pastor's wife, @mrstammybrown , taught us that our daily time with god is the real delicacy that sustains us, not the 5⭐ experience, and my spirit animal @melodyworkman , schooled us on vulnerability and how to cultivate authenticity in exposing your own weaknesses or reality. #metoo 🙋🏻‍♀️ (*disclaimer: i don't believe in spirit animals, susan. 😂 #calmdown melody is a gorgeous and passionate speaker.)
.
.
oh yes, the decor was beautiful (yay @pambert ! 🎉), the teachings were world class, and the worship team brought the fiyaaa 🔥🔥🔥🙌🏼 . . . but my favorite part of this conference was the opportunity to serve and worship alongside other women in heartfelt communion to show love and kindness to others. i know women who were met at the well, and god met us in that moment and in that place, and the trajectory of lives changed and angled toward god and with god is the #1 prize. 🎁💝
.
.
thank you @cultivatewomen and tammy for your vision and sacrifice and for providing the opportunity for all kinds of women to come together to worship and learn in spirit and in truth. 💕😍🙌🏼 "i will risk being known, so i can rest being loved." 🤜🏼🤛🏼
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
#sandalschurch #sandalschurchev #cultivatewomen #ifoundaplacetobereal #kindwoman #womankind #iamwhoyousayiam #jesusismyjam #wiseandkind #kindnessrocks #butfirstjesus #uninvited #cultivate #cultivateconference2018 #lysaterkeurst

text:
i’ve stayed pretty quiet (mostly due to exhaustion from work and staying off illness); but i’m angry and tired. a supreme court nominee needs to be unbiased and impartial. already mr kavanaugh has proven that he cannot be that way. a brave woman stepped forward to report sexual assault. and i’ve seen family, friends, and acquaintances be dismissive and judgemental ever since for varying reasons. 
13 years ago i was afraid, thought i was in love and could change him... he went on to do the same to 4 other women leaving me guilt ridden even 13 years later. i was wearing a baggy soccer tee and jeans. #whyididntreport

7 years ago i met someone i admired in the industry i wanted to go into. my wine tasted funny after coming back from the restroom, even though my other friends around “watched” my glass. i tried to report it, and was told “are you sure you weren’t just drunk and regret it?” i was wearing my old work uniform (white button down, tie, and black pants) #itriednothinghappened 
i know better than anyone how seriously damaging false accusations can be of this nature. but the reactions surrounding this entire situation are completely disgusting and disrespectful. #metoo

text:
for this week’s read~watch~listen i have the blasey ford kavanaugh testimony. .
the blasey ford/kavanaugh testimony was heart wrenching. two people told two completely different stories. blasey ford calmly but firmly told the story of a sexual assault by judge kavanaugh. the gall of the press and some of those in congress of her disremembering is infuriating. when i was 10, i was assaulted by a man while i was completing a craft project at his store. i remember how he looked, how he smelled, the feeling of his lips on my face and my neck. i remember ducking under his arms to run down the stairs and run home before anything else could happen. i got home i washed the parts of my body that he touched until it was raw. like dr. ford, i never told anyone.
.
kavanaugh, his testimony was filled with self-pity, emotion and rage. i do honestly feel badly for him. he consistently didn't answer or mislead the committee most worrisome was his disrespect to the women on the committee. props to jeff flake for pushing an fbi probe. .
read: “in the #metoo era, raising boys to be good guys” by david mcglynn in the new york times. as the mother of 12-year-old twin boys, i want to raise my sons not to be jerks. and the thought of them harassing girls, harassing anyone (except maybe each other) is horrifying, especially since they are being raised by two moms. .
watch: the handmaid’s tale if you haven’t read or watched this it’s a must. this dystopian novel written in the 80’s women treated as property. it’s frightening how there appears glimpses of how this could happen today. you can find the handmaid's tale on hulu, the first season of the can also be found on netflix. .
listen: the daily sept 28th. today’s daily by the nyt did an impartial job of discussing the hearing and worth this listen. the daily can be found on apple podcasts, google play, stitcher or where ever you get your favorite podcast.
.
.
.

#metoo #metoomovement #lgbtparents #parents #womenempowerment #kavenaughhearing #podcasts #newyorktimes #podcastaddict #handmaidstale #hulu #netflix

text: to my women friends.  women are strong, women are beautiful.  thank you ladies for helping me through so much this year.  i dunno what i would do without your softness, your vulnerability, empathy and love.  let’s not forget brutal honesty that i need.  i love you ladies.  this week has really made me see how much i value my female friendships.  in particular @slinkygirl311 @dreambiscuit @flopalop and @queenofcoolpantsandcatshirts.  psa that hat says “make america rage again”’ lol #fucktrump

text:
because of the news these days and #metoo let me share this important message:⁣
⁣
when i finally allowed myself to get angry, everything in my life changed for the better. i went from being a victim to a victor - that's when i started on the path of leading my life with personal power and liberating the visionary within.
⁣
that was about 26 years ago.⁣
⁣
do not be afraid of your anger.⁣
⁣
something outside of you may have triggered you to be angry, yet once you are angry it is all about you. it's your emotional energy in your body.⁣
⁣
anger is a powerful wisdom. i suggest you listen to it.⁣
⁣
knowing how to respond to your anger in a way that will honor your life is important, otherwise it can turn into an extreme emotional experience such as aggression, victimization, violence, chronic stress, depression or more.⁣
⁣
if you haven't yet, give yourself permission to get angry. and then honor your life by honoring your anger. ⁣
⁣
your ability to respond with integrity is vitally important.⁣
⁣

name: Lori DiGuardi
tweet_full:
because of the news these days and #metoo let me share this important message:⁣
⁣
when i finally allowed myself to get angry, everything in my life changed for the better. i went from being a victim to a victor - that's when i started on the path of leading my life with personal power and liberating the visionary within.
⁣
that was about 26 years ago.⁣
⁣
do not be afraid of your anger.⁣
⁣
something outside of you may have triggered you to be angry, yet once you are angry it is all about you. it is your emotional energy in your body.⁣
⁣
anger is a powerful wisdom. i suggest you listen to it.⁣
⁣
knowing how to respond to your anger in a way that will honor your life is important, otherwise it can turn into an extreme emotional experience such as aggression, victimization, violence, chronic stress, depression or more.⁣
⁣
if you have not yet, give yourself permission to get angry. and then honor your life by honoring your anger. ⁣
⁣
your ability to respond with integrity is vitally important.⁣
⁣
your emotional energy matters. your anger matters. your truth matters. let it be a powerful healing force.⁣
⁣
my book is all about this anger experience. it will help. reach out if you need additional support. get the book, link in bio.
#leadwithpersonalpower #yourvoiceyourpurposeyourlife #visionarywomen

text: we sit on the stand now, we hold up elevators, we tweet, share, shout and bear our scars - our wounds - in hopes that one day our sisters/daughter/mothers won’t have to. in hope that sexual assault and harassment isn’t commonplace, it’s rare and unfathomable. so that when adults tell children to tell a trusted adult when something bad happens, and that bad person will be in trouble - that we actually believe ourselves. so that we aren’t ashamed, scared or hopeless to tell someone - that we are emboldened to seek justice because justice is actually what happens. we stand now, together, and we vote now for every person before us, who are with us now and will be in the future. #thankyoudrford #believesurvivors #werecomingforyou #metoo

text:
i heart my landlord. 
which reminds me of a landlord i had at elon, for some reason. margaret was gone for the weekend. while i was hanging my laundry on the line, he told me he was headed to the farmer’s market. he later offered me cantaloupe and other fruit. when he handed me the bag of fruit, he closed his eyes, puckered up, and leaned in. i backed away, took the bag and went home, (our backyards met) to a place where he had a key. this is memory i think about it, not as assault or harassment, but highly inappropriate. the fact that he had a key and i was terrified and uncomfortable is not a crime. it’s certainly not something to report. does any police department in any state have time for “my 65 year old landlord tried to kiss me, i’m 21. keep an eye on him, he might assault someone.” he didn’t commit a crime. he made me uncomfortable in my living space, for which he was receiving income. 
i suspect this happened before my semester in spain, so i was still recovering from actually being sexually assaulted by a stranger while i was sleeping surrounded by friends, literally. roommate right next to me within 12” and her boyfriend perpendicular to my feet. he got away and no one knows his identity. i didn’t talk to anyone that night i didn’t know. i woke up because i couldn’t breathe, he was on top of me with all his weight. he only left because my friends walked in a second time and told him he had to leave. they thought he was hooking up with my roommate who was sleeping next to me with her boyfriend at my feet. and everyone was so supportive after. my academic advisor actually was supportive, and i was fortunate that the counselor on campus who he sent me was often called by the state of nc to testify for the prosecution as an expert in sex crimes. he understood sexual assault and was a great source for cognitive therapy. 
and then there was a bf and a person i dated who thought it okay to have sex with me while i was sleeping. #whileiwassleeping

this doesn’t include the assault in high school. it was my fault he put everclear in my drink with the intention of taking advantage of me. #predators 
#fuckkavanaugh #metoo

text:
hi i’m hannia and i’m a survivor..
why a survivor, let me tell you a bit of my story, before i got to my 11th birthday i have survived 3 sexual assaults, having talk about one of them and being over victimized, blame for it and experience a divided family due to it.. is fair to say that was the first and last time i talk about my assaults.  until a few days ago i never mention the other 2 to anyone bc of fear, fear of judgment, fear of been accused one more time that it was something i did to deserve it.. crazy how we victimized the victim,  i was 7 the first time that it happen.. and if i look back i only have one happy memory of my childhood; i built so many emotional barriers that i got numb.. but i survived and rise .. now i’m telling this today bc i know i’m not the only one, i know how painful it is, i know how scary it is to talk about it, to even remember, i know how people instead of showing support point fingers at you an cast you out.. i wasn’t sure to share this here, it’s scary but i believe that any woman, child or anyone that suffer abuse of any kind, should speak up, we should be able to tell our stories without judgment, fear or shame. so i choose to tell my story bc if by doing so i can help one soul to share hers and feel supported it was worth it. i survived depression (thanks to my #oils), anger issues, pain, i cry more that i laughed; but let me tell you this, i found myself blossom into a stronger and kind human being. today i dry my tears and stand up with my face high to the sky, bc i know i’m worthy and i have nothing to be ashamed. so girl.. yes you that might be crying at night hiding from everyone, you that keep her pain to herself.. let met tell you are not alone, you are a beautiful soul, worthy of love, respect and have nothing to be ashamed. it’s ok to feel the pain but don’t give your abuser the power to control your happiness. 
you are worthy of happiness and joy, you are love and most of all you are a survivor! 
so i encourage y’all to be embracing and supportive to others, you never know the pain that they might be hiding and enduring, help when you can and please don’t judge. .
#mindfulmom #metoo #timesup #nomeansno

text: to all of you who have survived & are fighting, i see you. i believe you. i hear you. i don’t speak publicly about my assault on the gram. so here’s the gist, i was sexually assaulted. i was raped. i won’t ever publicly name my rapist because he’s dead now & it’s not a face that screams “i like to rape girls” that’s what i was, a girl. he was a trusted family friend. so for those of you who don’t understand why some of us don’t come forward. here’s the reasons i didn’t. i was humiliated, degraded, & afraid. i am gonna hashtag this post because it’s important for folks to hear & read they are not alone, they are believed & it’s the gram so hashtags it is.😊 #nomore #isurvived #metoo #ibelieveher #believewomen #lovemore #survivor #ibelieveyou #lifeisstillbeautiful #shareyourstory 💖✌🏽

text:
big news—i just heard michelle obama speak. if you read my earlier post, you know that today was a hard day for me, as it was for many, many women in this country. i can think of nothing that could make me feel more hopeful, inspired, and ready to do my part to bring change than to be with these young women, in the presence of michelle obama, and to hear her speak. we were also lucky to hear angela rye, keegan-michael key, and kelly rowland speak.

michelle obama is an amazing speaker. her voice oozes warmth and compassion. her words are full of grace and intelligence. she urged the crowd to care more and be more active. to vote. 
the last election was decided by the non-voters. half of the us population does not vote. if you do not vote, you have no voice. your voice is your power. use it. don’t give it away to people who do not care about you.

#michelleobama #keeganmichaelkey #kellyrowland #angelarye #ibeliveher #womensupportingeachother #timesup #metoo #womensrights #healing #ilovemydaughters #weareher #vote2018 #womenvote #voteforyourlife #useyourvoice #useyourpower

text:
if you don't support survivors you're a trash human being. it's not up for debate. and you can miss me with that devil's advocate bullshit.

text:
hang on...
we hear you...
we see you...
we believe you...
the voices that have rang 
the loudest, are starting to crack...
the toxic masculinity is starting to
crumble...
and, we will be here...
to pick up the pieces, and 
rebuild...
the system has always been 
broken...
so, it's a damn good thing we know
how to fix shit...
how to make something 
from nothing...
how to fight, and yell...
when we need to...
but, also how to listen & heal...
times up...
we are here
we are strong

text:
actrices confiesan por qué decidieron hablar los abusos en hollywood

no se quedaron calladas.
tras la condena a prisión por abuso sexual del comediante bill cosby, las audiencias de confirmación en el senado del candidato de trump a juez de la corte suprema brett kavanaugh, denunciado por abusar de varias mujeres, se ha transformado en el más reciente campo de batalla del movimiento #metoo. entre los argumentos de la defensa de kavanaugh - esgrimida incluso por el propio presidente de los ee.uu. en twitter - se encuentra el hecho de que no había sido denunciado penalmente hasta ahora.

comenzando con la presentadora padma lakshimi, las redes comenzaron a poblarse de relatos de mujeres, conocidas y desconocidas, con el hashtag #whyididn'treportit (por qué no lo denuncié), donde explican las razones de su silencio de incluso décadas y por qué han decidido dejar de callar.

la actriz y modelo cara delevingne confesó que "me sentía avergonzada de lo que había pasado y no quería arruinarle la vida a alguien en público, aunque en privado me la hubiesen arruinado a mí". lily reinhart, de la serie riverdale, afirmó que "no quería perder mi trabajo ni que la gente pensara que era una exagerada". alyssa milano , actriz y productora y uno de los rostros más combativos de time's up, se

actrices confiesan por qué decidieron hablar los abusos en hollywood

no se quedaron calladas.
tras la condena a prisión por abuso sexual del comediante bill cosby, las audiencias de confirmación en el senado del candidato de trump a juez de la corte suprema brett kavanaugh, denunciado por abusar de varias mujeres, se ha transformado en el más reciente campo de batalla del movimiento #metoo. entre los argumentos de la defensa de kavanaugh - esgrimida incluso por el propio presidente de los ee.uu. en twitter - se encuentra el hecho de que no había sido denunciado penalmente hasta ahora.

comenzando con la presentadora padma lakshimi, las redes comenzaron a poblarse de relatos de mujeres, conocidas y desconocidas, con el hashtag #whyididn'treportit (por qué no lo denuncié), donde explican las razones de su silencio de incluso décadas y por qué han decidido dejar de callar.

la actriz y modelo cara delevingne confesó que "me sentía avergonzada de lo que había pasado y no quería arruinarle la vida a alguien en público, aunque en privado me la hubiesen arruinado a mí". lily reinhart, de la serie riverdale, afirmó que "no quería perder mi trabajo ni que la gente pensara que era una exagerada". alyssa milano , actriz y productora y uno de los rostros más combativos de time's up, se

for all of those struggling and triggered by the current news and climate around it - i am asking for your sake, that you be gentle with yourself.
•
take breaks from social media and the news. do not feel forced to share your story or anything about it - you do not owe anyone that. if you don’t want to, don’t try to educate others on the situation or topic (you aren’t doing a disservice - they also have google!!) connect with a loved one. make an appointment to see your therapist. if you need, reach out to a crisis line like crisis text line (text ‘start’ to 741-741) or rainn (sexual violence hotline 1-800-656-4673).
•
rest. let your fellow women support you. care for yourself.
•
you are not alone. your story is valid. your struggles are valid. take care of yourself, love.
•
•
•
#mentalhealth #selfcare #believewomen #ibelieveher #believesurvivors #metoo #metoomovement #survivor #ptsd #feminist #feminism #trauma #christineblaseyford #ibelievedrford #stopkavanaugh #timesup #whyididntreport #stopsupportingabusers #trustwomen #genderviolence #fuckabusers #fuckrapists #fuckthepatriarchy #survivorsolidarity #listentosurvivors

text:
yo te aseguro que cada mujer (y cada hombre) en el mundo que ha sido víctima de abuso sexual lo recuerda. está allí; con ella o con el, todos los días de su vida. así funcione, trabaje, sonría, lleve a sus hijos al colegio, se vista bonito o decida no arreglarse más (porque ustedes saben la costumbre que hay de culpar a la victima por vestirse de manera “provocativa” y otra lista de sin-sentidos similares) esos recuerdos, ese trauma está ahí. así no se lo cuente a nadie, así no lo comparta, así lo guarde en lo más profundo de su ser, es real, existe. 
l
existe, aunque años después no recuerde cada detalle, así no sepa como estaba vestido su agresor o el nombre y apellido de cada persona que vio ese día. saben que una de las maneras que tiene nuestro cerebro de protegernos del trauma es justamente hacernos olvidar? por eso aveces hay recuerdos parciales que no por eso dejan de ser reales. reales como las huellas, reales como la herida que un evento así causa en la vida de un ser humano para siempre. 
l
yo te creo, yo creo en ti. creo en que lo que te paso es real y se que te duele, se que es una jodida realidad a la que la sociedad nos ha sometido. por favor no sientas culpa. no sientas vergüenza. fuiste una víctima de abuso y aquí estás, te sobrepusiste o todavía estás tratando de sobreponerte. tu voz tiene altavoces, ya no es silente. con personas valientes como la dra. ford, y miles más que se han armado de valor para hacerle frente a los cobardes que les agredieron, estamos cambiando la historia. como? una historia a al vez. 
l
espero que todo lo que está pasando ahorita con kavanaugh, envíe un mensaje claro a los “niños” de 17 años y les enseñe que las consecuencias de sus actos duran para toda la vida y les explotará en la cara en algún momento. no hay más impunidad. nos unimos como mujeres, despertamos y nos vamos a proteger, vamos a hablar y vamos a denunciar. se acabo! 🙅🏻‍♀️🙅🏻‍♀️🙅🏻‍♀️
#nomasvictimas #stopkavanaugh #nokavanaugh #ibelievesurvivors #believesurvivors #believesurvivorsnow #metoo #femalepower #noesno #nomeansno #ceroimpunidad #yolecreoalasvictimas #poweredbytotallymedia #victimasdeabusosexual #nomas

"kearl says she was surprised at how few of the victims confronted their harasser. instead, they changed their own lives to avoid harassers and reduce their risks of being harassed." https://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2018/02/21/587671849/a-new-survey-finds-eighty-percent-of-women-have-experienced-sexual-harassment

text:
in an alternate timeline : ⠀yeah. she’s right...i did this horrible thing. i don’t regret many things in my life, but this is one of them. i was a kid and a total idiot, who caved into backwards ideas about what it was to be a man. it was disgusting, harmful, and although i have processed this privately, i realize that i need to do more publicity to correct what i’ve done, supporting policy and adding to conversation that makes it known that none of this is acceptable, and it never was.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
i am deeply sorry.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
( or something like that)
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
dedicated to all the women who deserve this and so much more.
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
myself included

i have to believe we are getting there. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀
